DESCRIPTION:
Quite possibly the most well known of all the Japanese distillery, Yamazaki has produced this malt to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the launch of the single malt.
Distilled in 1984, it was bottled in 2009.
Yamazaki has an amazing history and was founded by Shinjiro Torii in 1923. However, the first spirit was produced from the stills on the 11th November at 11:11am 1924.

Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

A vatting of some of the rarest and most exceptional casks of Glenfiddich single malt whisky.
This bottling has been taken from the archives of Glenfiddichs malt masters election - Brian Kinsman.
The bottle was gifted to Brian Robertson after at least 30 years of service as a Mashman at the distillery. 
Never seen at auction before and is guaranteed to be at least 47 years of age!

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
There are five Rare Malt Broras released and it is said that 1972 vintage is quite frankly exceptional.  This Brora 22 year old was bottled at 58.7% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - 2015 Bourbon Barrel #213 65.7% | Held In Bond
DESCRIPTION:
A great chance to be the new owner of a 5 (Almost 6) Year Old Glenallachie Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Whisky Broker.
Filled on the 10.08.2015, cask #213 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged in April 2020. 
There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
Original bulk 193.73L | Fill strength 67% ABV | 129.80L of alcohol.New bulk 184.46L | New strength 65.5% ABV | 120.82L of alcohol.
If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 263 bottles of 5 Year Old Glenallachie. 
Whiskybroker is currently holding this cask and the storage fee is £0.28 per week with insurance at £0.0035 a year per £1 of the value of the cask.
The buyer is responsible for the £20 administration fee is payable to Whiskybroker. 
Please Note -
This is an incredibly rare 25 year old Speyside single malt.  It was distilled at The Macallan in 1968.  It was bottled for the UK market in 1994 for the highly decorated Anniversary Malt range.

The most collectable single malt in the world, Macallan currently holds the record for the most expensive single malt ever sold at auction. 
The distillery is owned by the Edrington Group who purchased it in 1999 from Highland Distillers. 
This bottling was distilled in 1957 and bottled Campbell, Hope and King Ltd who were based in Edinburgh in the 19th century & into 20th century. The company also had premises in New Elgin from which the relationship with Macallan would have blossomed. Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

The most collectable single malt in the world, Macallan currently holds the record for the most expensive single malt ever sold at auction. 
The distillery is owned by the Edrington Group who purchased it in 1999 from Highland Distillers. 
This bottling was distilled in 1957 and bottled Campbell, Hope and King Ltd who were based in Edinburgh in the 19th century & into 20th century. The company also had premises in New Elgin from which the relationship with Macallan would have blossomed. Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

Prior to the 1980s the bottling of Macallans product was subcontracted out to independent bottlers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 35th Anniversary of Private Eye magazine 1996
DESCRIPTION:
If we told you that Macallan used to be focus on being included in various blends, would you believe us? Probably not but it is true!
The brand decided to focus on their single malt brand in the 60s and 70s which coincided with the distillery licensing  Hope & King and Gordon & MacPhail.
This bottling has grown to become one of the most collectable bottles that Macallan have produced. Released in 1996 for the 35th Anniversary of Private Eye magazine.
Its unique design and screen printed label is by Ralph Steadman, who was the illustrator for the magazine. 
5000 bottles were produced in total and one cask from 1961 was used.
This is bottle number 1313.

The Macallan Folio 1 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2015.  This is one of 2000 bottles.
Folio 1 is the first release in a 24 part series that celebrates and revisits The Macallan's original print, press and film advertising campaign; mapping the story of The Macallan from a remote farmstead on the River Spey to a whisky that is enjoyed around the world.
As with all the Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

A sherry butt of Ardbeg from the legendary 1976 batch, this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2002.
This is bottle number 370.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Daftmill x 5 - 2005 Inaugural, 2006 Winter & Summer, 2007 Winter & 2008 Summer
DESCRIPTION:
Daftmill has become increasingly popular over the past few years it is so hard for collectors to get their hands on one bottle, let along all 5 at once!!!
The five bottles in this lot from Daftmill distillery are as follow including:
Inaugural Release 2005 - 2018, 55.8%2006 - 2018 Summer Batch Release 46%2006 - 2018 Winter Batch Release 46%2007 - 2019 Winter Batch Release 46%2008 - 2019 Summer Batch Release 46%
The inaugural release bottle number is 273 of 629.

Since the takeover by Ian Macleod distillers, there has only been two single casks released to the public and this is one of them! Only 259 bottles have been produced from cask #625 and were only available via a ballot in the first quarter of 2020.
Rosebank has been shut down since 1993 and is a favourite by many. Never tried a Lowland distillery...start here. 
This is bottle number 5 of 269

Matured in both American and European Oak casks, this single malt from Speyside has been matured for 30 years.
It has a whisky tint of 17 and tasting notes of vanilla and sandalwood.
One of Bob Dalgarno's fines whiskies.
Glen Garioch - 1971 is a vintage single cask bottling that has been bottled exclusively for Oddbins.

This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. The 2018 series was made available for Asia and the USA. The series originated from some single cask bottlings in the 90's that are described at some of the greatest Macallans of them all. 
This bottling has the reference is 2018/ESH-14369/11 and is one of only 228 bottles.
It was distilled on the 13th of October 1997 and bottles 21+ years later. It was matured in a single Sherry hogshead made from European Oak. Steven Bremner selected this cask and was the 11th cask to be reserved for the 2018 series on 6th July 2018.

This 2018 Exceptional Single Cask from Macallan (2018/ESH – 3019/06) was distilled on the 18th of March 2002, matured for over 15 years in European Oak Sherry Hogshead and was bottled on the 4th of Mat 2018.  This is one of a very limited production of only 302 bottles.  This is another stunning single cask from Macallan.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach -  40 Year Old 1972 Single Cask #713 - LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 2nd of March 1972 and bottled in 2012 from single sherry butt #713. Matured for 40 years and then bottled at 50.2%. This is one of 476 bottles produced exclusively for La Maison du Whisky.
 
This is bottle number 256.

The start of this series began in 1981 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1981.
The tube is for a 1982 and bottle is a 1981 vintage.

This Macallan is very collectable and highly acclaimed.
It was distilled in 1973 but previously had been stored in sherry wood casks.
This 18 year old rare and collectable is hugely sought after.

Part of the highly collectable Macallan Easter Elchies series, this bottling is highly sought after whisky for collectors
The 2010 Easter Elchies bottling was from a single sherry butt cask #432, distilled in 1997 and bottled in 2010. It comes with a stunning orange signature ribbon around the bottle.

This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. 
This ESC release has the reference is 2019/ESB-5542/02 and is one of only 581 bottles.
Distilled on 16th April 1997 and bottled over 21 years later on 26th April 2019, after maturing in single European oak first-fill sherry hogshead #5542.
Selected by Macallan Whisky Maker Steven Bremner, this was the 2nd cask to be reserved for the 2019 series.

The start of this series began in 1981 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1981.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 33 Year Old - Old Malt Cask 1969
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1969, This Macallan bottled by Douglas Laing 33 years later at cask strength is Speyside gem!
Only 102 bottles were produced back in April 2003 and boasting the older style of DL packaging, this bottle certainly will catch the avid collectors eye!

This Macallan limited edition commemorates the 60th anniversary of Elizabeth II's coronation in 1953.  The Windsor red, blue and gold packaging was designed by David Holmes. 
The pack contains 2 x 35cl bottles:

Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

Selected by one of the distillers, Sarah Burgess, this is part of the 2017 release and more specifically the 9th release from that year. It comes from a single European oak sherry butt #5234.
It was distilled in March of 2005 and subsequently bottled 12 years later. It is one of only 468 bottles.

This vintage Macallan 18 Year Old is from 1978.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years in Sherry Oak casks handpicked and made in Jerez, Spain.
Bottled around 1996, the packaging of this bottle is iconic - the purple sashed box features Sara Midda's lovely watercolours of the iconic Easter Elchies house.

Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Distilled on the 30th March 2005, matured in single European oak sherry butt #5234 and bottled over 12 years later at 66.1%.  Selected by Master Distiller Bob Dalgarno, this was the ninth cask to be released for the 2017 series.
This is one of only 468 bottles.

mAtured for over 38 years at Benriach distillery, this bottle is just one of 158 bottles from cask #2383, a Sherry hogshead. Distilled in 1966 and bottled in December of 04, this is a very limited release and you hardly ever see a BEnriach of this age.
This bottling has been selected by the legendary Billy Walker. 
This is bottle number 64 of 158.

This is the 2019 edition of Macallan's 25 Year Old Sherry Oak. It comes with a stunning wooden presentation box.  It's matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry oak casks from Jerez for a quarter of a century.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.

One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

Single Cask of Daftmill bottled exclusively for Royal Mile Whiskies. This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies. Daftmill is a farm distillery. Owned and operated by the Cuthbert family, it only runs in the farm's quiet periods; midsummer and winter, sometimes producing as few as 100 casks per year.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this lowland whisky. This single cask is a perfect representation of the Daftmill style and was voted for democratically by the Royal Mile Whiskies tasting team. Such a thorough investigation of the warehouses was only made possible with Mr Cuthbert's generosity and patience, as well as Mrs Cuthbert's delicious baking. 
Bottle number 21 of 231.

The Brora 38 Year Old was released in 2016 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This is bottle number 384.

The Brora 38 Year Old was released in 2016 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This is bottle number 151.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

A 31 year old from the Speyside distillery that in 2017 this whisky was awarded World's Best Single Malt at the World Whiskies Awards.
It has been matured in both first-fill and refill casks, and bottled at cask strength.
If you have never been to Craigellachie make sure you stop at The Highlander Inn, you will not be disappointed!
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - Fèis Ìle 2019 -1988 Champagne Finish + Sample
DESCRIPTION:
Bunnahabhain released three bottlings for 2019 Feis Ile on Islay. This is by far and away the most spectacular of the three, coming in at 30 years old. It comes with a 1cl tasting mini and in a beautiful leather case. One of the lighter whiskies on Islay, combined with this champagne cask is a recipe for success.
Distilled on 1st December 1988 and bottled on 17th May 2019.
One of only 120 bottles.
Bottle 78 of 120.

The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 28 Year Old - Yellow Trub Machine - SMWS 23.76
DESCRIPTION: This 28-year-old single cask Bruichladdich is one of an outturn of only 91 bottles. Yellow Trub Machine was released in celebration of the Islay Festival 2020. Bottled at 53.9%.

The Brora 37 Year Old was released in 2015 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?

Distilled in 1975 this is the very much sought after Glenmorangie 1975 Tain L'Hermitage that has been matured for around 28 years. 
Four of these years were spent finishing in casks which previously held Côtes du Rhône wine.
Bottle 2464.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Great Scottish Adventure - Elliott Erwitt (Masters of Photography) Cask #9439
DESCRIPTION:
From the distillery - "The Masters of Photography: Elliott Erwitt Edition was The Macallan’s most extensive, and ambitious to date, with 58 unique single cask whiskies being paired with a different signed print captured during his Scottish adventure. Only 35 of each of the exclusive pairings were made available, a complete global release of 2,030."
"Photography is an art of observation – it’s about creating something extraordinary out of the ordinary."Elliott Erwitt
This comes with print number #22

The Brora 35 Year Old was released in 2014 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.  Aged in a combination of refill American and European oak, this has the classic Brora waxiness.
 
This is bottle number 0763.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1989  Spiorad An Dochais Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 30 year old release was distilled at Bunnahabhain distillery and was bottled for the cancelled Fèis Ìle festival in 2020.
This bottling has spent most of its life maturing in a sherry cask before being transferred for a finishing period in virgin oak casks.
Said to be spicy but sweet the name Spiorad An Dochais mean spirit “Spirit of Hope” in Gaelic.
Only 200 bottles being produced.
This is bottle 178.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

With one of the strongest followings in all of Scotch Whisky, this Ardbeg is highly sought after. It is one of their oldest age statements and were present / bottled in the late 1970s until the early 1990s. 29 casks were used to produce this 30 year old release and many people will not know it was actually bottled at Laphoraig.
This is the last Ardbeg bottling produced by Aliied before the distillery's sale.

The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

This single cask (#8167/02) was distilled on 9th September 2002 and matured in a European oak sherry puncheon for 15 years, before being bottled at cask strength on 2nd May 2018 at 60.1% ABV.
Selected for the series by Macallan Whisky Maker Sarah Burgess, this expression is limited to just 627 bottles making it a highly collectable bottle.

In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 18 Year Old Fine Oak Triple Cask (6 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot contains 6 x 70cl bottle of Macallan - 18 Year Old - Fine Oak.
An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Founder’s Collection 2019 Single Cask + Mini + Pack #16
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2019 release and the first of four bottlings from the West London based Bimber Distillery. 
This is a single cask dram bottled at 57.8% ABV and taken from an ex-bourbon cask, which was laid down in 2016.
The four Founder’s Collection bottlings will be released until 2022 while being imited to 200 bottles each.
Only available to members of Bimber’s ‘Founder's Club’...and now you at TGWA. 
Bottle 41.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 13 Year Old - 2004 DCS Compendium Chapter #3
DESCRIPTION:
This is part 3, of a 5 part release from Balvenie. This 2004 vintage named "DCS Compendium" is 13 Years Old.
This third release of Balvenie's five-part DCS Compendium, is a tribute to David Stewart, the renowned malt master.
Distilled on 19th January 2004 and bottled 13 years later on the 19th of June 2017.
This is one of 372 bottles from single cask #741.

The Brora 34 Year Old was released in 2017 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St. Magdalene - 23 Year Old 1970 - Rare Malts Selection 58.1% ( With Wooden Presentation Box)
DESCRIPTION:
This 23 Year Old St. Magdalene was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.1% as part of the Rare Malts Selection.  It was distilled in 1970, using the traditional direct-fired stills. The distillery sadly closed in the 1980s. This is a collectable bottling.
This bottle come with a wooden presentation box from Fortnum & Mason.

This is a very collectable bottling from Ardbeg, released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018. It was distilled in April 2005 and filled into an Oloroso sherry butt, where it aged until April 2018. This is one of just 543 individually numbered bottles released.
Bottle 412

One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
Bottle 542 of 1000.

This first fill Bourbon barrel 048/2006 was filled on the 31st July 2006 and was selected by Ho-cheng Yao to be the first exclusive bottling for Taiwan.  Only 201 bottles were produced.  
This is bottle number 162.

This first fill Bourbon barrel 048/2006 was filled on the 31st July 2006 and was selected by Ho-cheng Yao to be the first exclusive bottling for Taiwan.  Only 201 bottles were produced.  
This is bottle number 39.

Matured in some very very special Oloroso sherry casks, this Glendronach was given 95 out of 100 in Jim Murrays Whisky Bible.
This, of course, gave it great credibility before it went on to win the GOLD MEDAL at the San Francisco Spirits Competition.
Bottle No AD/273

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St. Magdalene - 23 Year Old 1970 - Rare Malts Selection 58.1%
DESCRIPTION: This 23 Year Old St. Magdalene was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.1% as part of the Rare Malts Selection.  It was distilled in 1970, using the traditional direct-fired stills. The distillery sadly closed in the 1980s. This is a collectable bottling.

This first fill Bourbon barrel 048/2006 was filled on the 31st July 2006 and was selected by Ho-cheng Yao to be the first exclusive bottling for Taiwan.  Only 201 bottles were produced.  
This is bottle number 144.

This Convalmore was distilled in 1977 and bottled in 2013 giving it the great age of 36 years old. Only 2680 bottles were produced at a cask strength of 58%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.
This is bottle number 1206.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis - 23 Year Old (1990) - The President's Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in Septemebr 1990, matured in a bourbon barrel for 23 years, and bottled in June 2014, this single cask was originally released for the German market. This bottling celebrates 25 years of the distillery's ownership by Nikka. This is one of only 227 bottles. 
This is bottle number 161.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 17 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 17 year old single malt from Clynelish Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 61.8%. 
The Diageo Manager's Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 17 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 17 year old single malt from Clynelish Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 61.8%. 
The Diageo Manager's Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.

The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.
This is a Taiwan import.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 16 Year Old 2002 DCS Compendium Chapter #5
DESCRIPTION:
The final release for the five-part DCS Compendium series. It is a tribute to malt master, David Stewart and consists of the following...
An 16 year old, cask strength, 2002 vintage has been matured in a first fill American oak barrel.
The cask was filled on 18th September 2002 and eventually bottled in 2019.
It consists of a 2002 vintage, cask strength, 16 year old Balvenie

This 15 Year Old Macallan is of 1984 vintage, matured on the banks of the River Spey for 15 years.
It showcases Easter Elchies house on the front of the tube, this was originally painted by Sara Middleton.

Very rarely seen at auction this 20 Year Old Highland Park comes from Cask #13313 and was bottled by Robertson of Kirkwall.
For those who are not familiar with David Robertson, he built Highland Park in 1798.
The distinctive Dragon that appears on the front label comes from the 12th century carving in Maes Howe tomb on Orkney.

One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
Bottle 521 of 1000.

This 2007 vintage single cask is very special and very hard to come by with only 245 bottles being produced from a single First Fill Bourbon Barrel.
This single butt #5824 was bottled on the 12th June 2019.
Bottle #11

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - Clan Mackenzie Series (Mackenzie, Castle Leod & Cromartie)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot consists of 3 x 70cl bottles of Dalmore - Clan Mackenzie Series bottlings: 
A 'significant proportion' of the profits from the original sale of each of these  bottles went to the Mackenzie Clan to help protect their ancestral seat Castle Leo
Bottle numbers:

Released on World Whiskey Day 2020, Redbreast Whiskey launched the third annual Dream Cask. A 28 year old ruby port single pot still whiskey.
This cask is made from a vatting of casks married together in this Port pipe.
Courtesy of Potstilled - 
Cask 1 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1989, matured in an ex-bourbon barrel and re-casked into a ruby port cask in 1995.
Cask 2 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in a second-fill ex-bourbon barrel.
Cask 3 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in a second-fill ex-bourbon barrel.
Cask 4 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in an ex bourbon barrel and re-casked into a sherry butt in 2011.
Only 912 bottled were produced.
This is bottle 894.
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

This is a collectable bottling from Ardbeg.  It was distilled in August 2011 and was matured in a 1st fill bourbon barrel until July 2018. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.2% ABV. This is one of just 256 individually numbered bottles produced from cask number 2198.
The bottle number is 210.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 27 Year Old Port Cask 1990 Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 27 years in Port casks, this super premium Bowmore was distilled in 1990.
It was later bottled in 2017 to celebrate Islays Feis Ile festival in 2017. 
Only 200 bottles were available at the distillery only.
Bottle number 30.
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

This cask is made from a vatting of casks married together in this Port pipe.

Cask 3 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in a second-fill ex-bourbon barrel.
Cask 4 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in an ex bourbon barrel and re-casked into a sherry butt in 2011.
Only 912 bottled were produced.
Bottle 601.

A celebratory bottle for the 50th anniversary of one of the best noses in the Scotch Whisky Industry...Richard Patterson. This bottling was released in 2016 and of course is a limited edition. 
Complex in nature this dram was finished in a total of 5 different wine casks - 
Mr Patterson handpicked them all and his reason for choosing these are because they reflect his two greatest passions - Dalmore and Exceptional Red Wine.
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 17 Year Old Douglas Murdoch 59.5% Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
An independent bottling of Port Ellen by Douglas Murdoch and it has been released at cask strength.
17 Years were spent in the cask before bottling.

Released on World Whiskey Day 2020, Redbreast Whiskey launched the third annual Dream Cask. A 28 year old ruby port single pot still whiskey.
This cask is made from a vatting of casks married together in this Port pipe.

Only 912 bottled were produced.
Bottle 391.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow, Ballykilcavan & Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilvan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV
Bannow Island 1.1 is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

Released on World Whiskey Day 2020, Redbreast Whiskey launched the third annual Dream Cask. A 28 year old ruby port single pot still whiskey.
This cask is made from a vatting of casks married together in this Port pipe.
Courtesy of Potstilled - 
Cask 1 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1989, matured in an ex-bourbon barrel and re-casked into a ruby port cask in 1995.
Cask 2 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in a second-fill ex-bourbon barrel.
Cask 3 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in a second-fill ex-bourbon barrel.
Cask 4 – a single pot still Irish whiskey distilled in 1991, matured in an ex bourbon barrel and re-casked into a sherry butt in 2011.
Only 912 bottled were produced.
This is bottle 436

A Limited edition, released to celebrate of the reopening of Macallan's second still house, which had been closed for over 20 years.
This is one of 1002 bottles individually numbered bottles, which were exclusively available from the distillery.
This is bottle number 654.

Swamp Oak Single Cask has a great story to go with the name.
Bottled in September 2005 from cask number 1946. The cask was distilled and laid down in May 1993.
Bill Lumsden started to experiment with different oak casks. Some successful and some...well not so much. This was definitely one of the successful ones. Others include Missouri, Truffle, Poat and Burr Oak. 
Only 247 bottles came from this outturn and it was the lowest amount of the series. 
During shipment, the bottles were LOST!! Some years later they were found and returned to the distillery.
Bottle number 179.

Originally released around the year 2000, this is the 2016 release, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 30-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.
Distilled at Ardbeg distillery in 1975, this limited edition was bottled in 2000 not long after the Glenmorangie takeover.

Part of the Douglas Laing super premium range and the Xtra Old Particular brand comes this Bowmore 1989 vintage. 
If we are honest it is one of the nicest bottlings that Douglas laying product with the gold emblem on the front and velvet box. 
DL/REF: 13204
All bottles are individually numbered of which there are only 276. 
This is bottle number 154.

The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.  This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles.
This is bottle number 2842.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

A private cask bottling from the Springbank distillery in Campbeltown. The distillery is huge among fans across the world. 
This is a fresh sherry cask #341 bottled at 57.7%. 
That colour though...

Hugely Iconic and recognised all around the world, Ardbeg has not always had things their own way. The distillery was bought by Hiram Walker and DCL in 1959. Their intention was to use this special malt for blending whiskies...
Thankfully this was not the case with Hiram Walker struggling in the late 1980s.
Ever since then the Glenmorangie group have owned the distillery reviving it properly in 1997.
It was hard for the group and revived distillery to produce a core range because of the lack of depth in the cask department...
This is the first age statement at a lovely 17 years old.

This limited edition is the 2009 Feis Ile bottling from Lagavulin - a single cask, cask strength whisky selected from warehouse #1 by Iain McArthur.
Distilled on the 18th October 1995 then bottled in 2009 from cask no. 4556.
 
This is bottle number 354.

2009 was the start of this great series to the Ardbeg Committee members.
This is the original Ardbeg Supernova, peated to 100 ppm.
Only 2,400 bottles were produced.

Bivrost Niflheim is a single malt from the world's northernmost distillery! Produced using Nordic barley and matured in a combination of sherry, bourbon and virgin oak casks.
Distilled in Arctic Norway at the foot of the Lyngen Alps and matured in an underground storage vault, previously part of a network of tunnels in a Cold War NATO base.
This is aurora Spirit's inaugural release.
Bottle 565

This bottling was released in 2013 and was a very limited run.
Initially matured in American white oak before being transferred into a combination of Palomino Fino sherry butts and first-fill bourbon cask.
However, the Story of the Dalmore 25 doesn't quite stop there...it was then married together in bourbon barrels before a final finishing period in Tawny port pipes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old - The Ian Hunter Story - Book 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 30 year old cask strength bottling from the 1987 vintage. This bottle forms the first chapter to the story of Ian Hunter and celebrates the man who introduced the iconic American white Oak barrels to the whisky making at Laphroaig. It is said that it was Ian who made Laphroaig what it is today.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Whisky Co - Macallan 28 Year Old - Batch 14 (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
'That Boutique-y Whisky Company' bottles a variety of well known single malt and single grain whiskies. Instantly recognisable, with their wonderfully colourful labels and comic book style designs, each label tells a hidden story about the distillery the bottle represents.
This very sought after Macallan is well-aged and will be a great buy to any collector.  This is one of 114 numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 29.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.
This 40 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

American & European oak cask matured, this is one of the Speyside distilleries oldest age statements to date.
I think we are all aware of the difficult times the distillery has had in the past with multiple closures but since its purchase in 1993 by Gordon and Machail it has done nothing but good things. Striking new labels and brand new designs combined with their golden liquid we hope for more of the same in the future.
This lot includes 3 x 70cl :

Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include the Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

Exclusively matured in Sherry oak casks for 27 years this beautifully presented bottle is part of the Grandeur series by the Highland distillery.
Only 2293 bottles produced making this a great item for collectors.
This is bottle number 817.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
A very old 1970 vintage Glenfarclas which has been independently bottled by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society (SMWS). It was distilled in Oct1970 and bottled 27 years later in February 1998.

This Convalmore was distilled in 1977 and bottled in 2005 at 28 years old.  This is one of only 3900 bottles produced at a cask strength of 57.9%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.
This is bottle number 2600.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
Bottle 2286

This limited edition bottling of 30-year-old Glen Grant was released in 1990 to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the distillery's opening, in 1840.
This is bottle number 608.

After maturing in single 1st fill sherry butts this Caperdonich was bottled in August 2011 by Gordon and Macphail.

Bottle 1002.

Distilled on the 8th of December 1981 comes this rare Brora single malt Highland whisky. A product selected and bottled from Direct Wines under the brand First Cask.
It is 23 years of age and will be in high demand with the distillery ready to reopen very soon!
Bottle number 143

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Bottle 585.

The London Edition (2019) from the Chichibu Distillery in Japan was bottled at 48.5%.  It was an exclusive distillery bottling for the Whisky Show.  
This is one of 1405 individually numbered bottles.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
Bottle number 1326.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date (minus 1), comprising of Edition no.2, 3 ,4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

From the oldest distillery on Islay. This is a rare bottling from the 1990s from Bowmore distillery.
A great age - 21 Year Old.

This very exclusive release is limited to only 395 bottles. It was matured on the banks of the River Lossie in Morayshire.
Distilled in 1967 this dram was bottled after 25 years. 
Bottle number 57.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask (Fine Oak) (6 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 6 x 70cl bottles of Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask (Fine Oak).
This 15-year-old Macallan single malt was is part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 21 Year Old - Rare Malts 1977 61.3%
DESCRIPTION:
Caol Ila 1977 21 Year Old Rare Malt bottling.
This rare single malt is part of a series done by Diageo of both operational and closed distilleries. 
This edition was distilled in 1977 and bottled at a very high strength of 61.3%

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - Rivers Collection - Spey, Tweed, Dee & Tay
DESCRIPTION:
The Dalmore Rivers Collection includes four bottlings named after four famous Scottish Salmon rivers, The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay. Each expression was bottled at 40%.  This lot includes 4 x 70cl bottlings.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.
A classic Salmon fishing river, the Spey runs in the heart of Scotland’s malt whisky region. The iconic status of the River Spey attracts people from around the world to fish it.
This Dalmore Tweed Dram celebrates the UK's best salmon river. Dalmore donated a good proportion of profits from this bottling, when originally sold, to the river's conservation fund.
The Tay dram was aged in bourbon and Oloroso sherry casks. When originally released, Dalmore donated £4 from every bottle sold to the Tay Foundation.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Speyside single malt, from Convalmore Distillery, is a 24-year-old and was bottled at cask strength (59.4%).

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 02/07/28 this is one of only 470 bottles produced.
A bottling to celebrate a century of distilling at the Strathmill distillery.

This Glengoyne was drawn from 7 casks numbered 1478 - 1485, all of 1972 vintage. This is one of only 2,400 individually bottles. 
This is bottle number 1116.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Hibiki 21 Year Old is a very popular blended whisky from Suntory.  It is made up of a blend of specially selected mature malt and grain whiskies aged over 21 years. The key Yamazaki sherry casked malt is vatted with other carefully chosen mellow unblended grain whiskies over 21 years old. 
Some awards Hibiki 21-Year-Old has received:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive & Wine
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a 2010 single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Gonzalez Byass Oloroso 2010 sherry: 750ml, 18%. The renowned Gonzalez Byass one of the most celebrated Bodegas across Spain. This Oloroso 2010 is stunning and very popular.  It is said to be short and dry, with notes of almond, plum and figs. Pair with game, cheese and nuts to bring out its natural, fruity undertones.
Bottle 588.

This stunning bottle is the first part of Highland Park's Valhalla Collection and was released in 2012
Thor is a 16-Year-Old single malt named after the Norse God of Thunder and alleged architect of the Cliffs of Yesnaby on the west coast of Orkney Mainland.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 23,000 bottles of Thor.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Ben Nevis was distilled in 1975 and bottled in 2001 at cask strength - 53.8%
Presented in the older style packaging, this is one of only 255 bottles produced from the cask. It has been hand signed by distillery manager at the time. 
Bottle number 87 of 255.

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
Bottle 200 of 400.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 8 Year Old 2009 DCS Compendium Chapter 4
DESCRIPTION:
This is part 4, of a 5 part release from Balvenie. This 2009 vintage named "DCS Compendium" is 8 Years Old.
This fourth release of Balvenie's five-part DCS Compendium, is a tribute to David Stewart, the renowned malt master.
Distilled: 7th April 2009
Bottled: 13th March 2018.
168 bottles coming from a single cask #2724.

Adam Hannett's first creation as Bruichladdich's distillery manager.
Its journey begins in May 2016 at last years Feis Ile in May 2016.
10 casks of 6 different types were used in the making of this expression.
1 x 2002; 2 x 2008; 4 x 2006; 3 x 2007 Vintages.
Bottle 1860

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Rosebank - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna (Wooden Box)
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram. Comes complete with original wooden box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

Bottled: 6th August 2018
Cask: Third fill hogshead #3197
One of 300 bottles.

This is a very rare 20cl bottling of 40-Year-Old Bunnahabhain.  Matured for four long decades, slowly and silently in the Bunnahabhain Distillery warehouses by the sea. This limited edition was bottled at 41.7% abv.

This stunning bottle is the first part of Highland Park's Valhalla Collection and was released in 2012

This limited edition twin pack brings together 2 x 70cl bottles of award-winning single malt from Old Pulteney in a handsome presentation case.

From the closed Diageo owned distillery, comes this 28 year old Port Ellen. Distilled in 1979 it was bottled in 2007.
This is even rarer at the 20cl bottling.

Bottle number 550.

It has been matured in a 50/50 mix of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dallas Dhu - 24 Year Old - 1970 Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION: This Rare Malts expression of 1970 vintage Dallas Dhu was bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.6%, this limited edition 24-year-old single malt was distilled in 1970.  The Dallas Dhu distillery was built in the Highlands, Scotland at the end of the 19th century, but is no longer operational.

This Rare Malts expression of 1978 vintage Mortlach was bottled at the natural cask strength of 62.2%, this limited edition 20-year-old single malt was distilled at Mortlach Distillery in 1978.  
This is bottle number 563.

This single cask release was fully matured in an Ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry cask #42. Sourced from Spain, this cask was previously utilised in a Jerez Solera for several decades, imparting a delectable selection of bright and rich fruit-forward notes. This is one of only 329 bottles produced. 
This is bottle number #160.

Released in June 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in American virgin oak cask #7 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.8%. This is one of just 249 bottles produced. 
This is bottle number 111.
Released in June 2020, this single cask Bimber, matured in ex-bourbon cask #8 was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.3%. This is one of just 267 bottles produced.

An amazing design and a wonderful expression once again by the Thompson Bros of Dornoch. Distilled in 1973 this bottle is one of just 437 bottles that was aged for 46 years!
The now-closed Carsebridge distillery is in the lowlands of Scotland and specialised in grain whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Mhor - 1979 Gordon and MacPhail Cask Strength​
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Gordon & MacPhail's Cask Strength series, this bottling was distilled on 25th May 1979 and bottled in May 1994 from cask #2376.
A great vintage from 1979, Glen Mhor.

The 1861 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan which was released before the 1874 reproductions.
These antique pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

The Linkwood 1978 is considered by some to be the finest of Diageo’s 2016 Releases. It’s been eight years since Linkwood featured on Diageo’s annual list. One of 6114 bottles.
This is bottle number 4850.

The Linkwood 1978 is considered by some to be the finest of Diageo’s 2016 Releases. It’s been eight years since Linkwood featured on Diageo’s annual list. One of 6114 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 35th Anniversary of Private Eye magazine 1996 5cl
DESCRIPTION:
If we told you that Macallan used to be focus on being included in various blends, would you believe us? Probably not but it is true!
The brand decided to focus on their single malt brand in the 60s and 70s which coincided with the distillery licensing  Hope & King and Gordon & MacPhail.
This bottling has grown to become one of the most collectable bottles that Macallan have produced. Released in 1996 for the 35th Anniversary of Private Eye magazine.
Its unique design and screen printed label is by Ralph Steadman, who was the illustrator for the magazine. 
5000 bottles were produced in total and one cask from 1961 was used.

This statement copper ice bucket is shaped like a Pagoda and is a luxurious addition to any drinks party.
Pagodas were designed to improve the flow of smoke out of the whisky distillery from the fires, traditionally used to dry the malt (barley), a key to any whisky.
Approx. Dimensions: 
18 inches tall (with the lid on)
10 inches wide (roof/lid)
10 inches deep (roof/lid)

This lot includes 4 x 70cl, from The Macallan Quest Collection, originally released for Travel Retail.
This lot comes with the presentation box.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.
Distilled in the heart of Speyside at Glenlivet distillery in 1983. This dram was bottled in 2003 after being finished in French Oak barrels.

DESCRIPTION:

This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.

Bottle 584.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 23 Year Old - Hunter Laing - Old & Rare 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Presented in this stunning wooden case with a silk-like varnished finish comes a Springbank 21 Year Old. It is one of only 136 bottles to be produced at 52.2%.
Part of the Old & Rare line from Hunter Laing this cask was laid down in 1995 and bottled in 2019. 
Bottled at cask strength. 
This is bottle number 11.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
Bottle number 592.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 22 Year Old - Twenty Something - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 edition of the Twenty Something releases, the third bottled exclusively for the Ardbeg Committee, the distillery's fan club.
This 22 year old was distilled in 1996, when the distillery was under the threat of demolition.  It was one of the last distillations in Ardbeg’s old equipment – these stills now sit monumentally outside the distillery gates.  The single malt was matured in ex-bourbon barrels from of some of the most limited stock in any Scottish distillery warehouse.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.1 2018 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2018 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
French Oak, Spanish Oak & American Oak.
This 30-year-old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Special Releases for 2019.  Matured in a combination of refill hogsheads and butts for three decades.
This 30-year-old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Special Releases for 2019.  Matured in a combination of refill hogsheads and butts for three decades.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 28 Year Old - 1989 Single PX Cask #5476
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in November 1989 and bottled in 2017 from single PX cask #5476. Matured for 28 years and then bottled at 49.9%.  This is one of 546 individually numbered bottles. This is the oldest from GlenDronach’s single cask Batch 16 release, the first batch from new Master Blender Rachel Barrie.

An Old Pulteney single cask from the Scottish Highlands distilled in 1983. 
This limited edition has been matured for a minimum of 33 years.
Until recently Old Pulteney held the record for the most northern distillery on the Mainland UK. It is now held by Wolfburn distillery and even they might lose the title to Thurso...

Dalmore 21 year old, released in 2015, has been matured in American oak for ten years prior to being moved to Gonzalez Byass Matusalem Oloroso Sherry butts.
These casks previously held sherry 30 years old.
This spectacular expression is one of 8000 bottles.

Distilled and blended by Suntory to mark their 100th Anniversary this is a piece of Japanese whisky history.
White barley motifs have been embossed on the decanted and the inscription on the bottles pay homage to Keizo Saji who is Shinjiro Torii’s second son.
Shinjiro Torii played a key part in the early stages of the Japanese whisky industry.
A special bottle indeed.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 27 Year Old PX G.A.S 1992 #5850 (With Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Specially selected for the Glendronach appreciation society & Abbeywhisky.com
This 27 year old was matured in a Pedro Ximenez puncheon #5850.
It was distilled on the 27/11/1992 and bottled in 2020. Only 625 bottles were produced. 
Cask Strength - 54.5%

This is a limited edition release commemorating a moment of drama in the history of Glenfiddich Distillery.  It was created by the Glenfiddich Malt master selecting and marrying the finest Oloroso and American oak casks from warehouses struck by heavy snow in the winter of 2010.  
The image on the front of the presentation tin illustrates the collapse of the warehouse roofs after twice a winter’s worth of snow fell just a few weeks. 
This is a no age statement bottling, however, the whisky is claimed to be from warehouses ranging from 13 to 30 years old.

Distilled in 1975, this Balmenach was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range in March 2007.  This Speyside single malt was matured in first-fill sherry casks, creating a rich and aromatic dram.

This 1988 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain is extremely limited and is one of just 1116 bottles produced.  Distilled in December 1988, and matured in warehouse 8, this single malt spent its final two years of maturation in marsala hogsheads.
Bottled in Jan 2019, at 47.4%.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Glendullan 26-Year-Old year was distilled in 1978. This limited edition was bottled at 56.6% in April 2005.
This is bottle number 3802.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Ord - 23 Year Old - Rare Malts 60.8%
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
Glen Ord was founded in 1838 on Clan Mackenzie land at Muir of Ord.
With a peaty nose and full-body, a lovely dram and still very rare at auction.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 24 Year Old - 1974 Rare Malt 55.7%
DESCRIPTION: This Rare Malts expression of 1974 vintage Royal Lochnagar was released in 2006. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.7%, this limited edition 24-year-old single malt was distilled in 1974.  The Royal Lochnagar distillery is situated close to Balmoral, the Queen’s official residence in Scotland.

Boasting a large and very well thought of core range full of expressions that are in the price range for people who are new to Whisky, comes this 30 Year Old Glenfiddich.
Glenfiddich is still one of the highest-grossing selling malts worldwide. With this 30-year-old it comes in the older style packaging.
This is a 1-litre bottling of 12 year old single malt from Macallan, bottled in the 1990s. Very collectable indeed.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

Mortlach 25 Year Old is the oldest expression from the distilleries 2014 releases.  Mortlach uses whisky matured mostly in refill American oak casks, aged for a quarter of a century before bottling the whisky into this striking bottle. This is a 50cl bottling.
Its beautiful nose of vanilla and pineapple with its deep and rich palate of dark chocolate, spices and dried fruit make this a lovely release.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.
This is single sherry cask Irish Pot Still whisky was specially bottled for The Whisky Exchange.  Distilled on 2 April 1999 it was aged for around 15 years in cask number #30087.

Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask was released exclusively to the travel retail market.
70cl is size, this limited edition is a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is a marriage of finest Oloroso Sherry and Wine Casks.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

This Cardhu 27-Year-Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1973 this Speyside single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.02% in October 2000.
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.
 
This is bottle number 3708.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold DC, 12 DC, 12 SO, & 12 TC Limited Edition Tins (4 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
A great chance to purchase three special edition bottlings from quite possibly the worlds most famous whisky maker, Macallan. 
The Speyside distillery released these bottlings in 2019 and have been very sought after. 
This lot comes with with 4 bottles total -

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North Port - 20 Year Old - 1979 Rare Malts 61.2%
DESCRIPTION:
This series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This single malt is from the closed distillery, North Port, that was demolished in 1983. Distilled in 1979, it was bottled at 20 Years old at the natural cask strength of 61.2%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottles.
Bottle 2777.

From one of Scotland’s lost distilleries, this Port Ellen is a very rare release. This is from Diageo’s yearly release of Port Ellen. It was distilled in 1979 and is 25 Years Old. 
A rare find with this smaller bottle.

The 1841 Replica is the third is a series of replicas from Macallan which was released in 2003 following the 1861 and 1874 reproductions.
These antique-esque pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelMortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - 46% This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

This 1971 vintage Glen Moray was bottled by the distillery in 1999 after being matured for 28 years in Oak casks.
Glen Moray is quietly matured on the banks of the River Lossie in Elgin, the capital of Speyside.

This Rare Malts expression of 1978 vintage Mortlach was bottled at the natural cask strength of 62.2%, this limited edition 20-year-old single malt was distilled at Mortlach Distillery in 1978.  
This is bottle number #3258.

Founded in 1817 by Captain Hugh Munro, this was one of Ross-shire first legal distilleries. The stills draw pure water from the Dairywell spring.
Based in Alness this Teaninich was distilled in 1973 and bottled at 57.1% ABV.

The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
