This Dufftown-Glenlivet 21-year-old was distilled in 1975 and bottled at 54.8% in 1997.
This is bottle number 3439.

One of the most collectable sets of Macallan you will find. Michael Jackson gave this malt 93/100 points and the tasting notes are from David Robertson - The master distiller at the time.
This expression is a re-creation of 1920's style Macallan.
Nose: Rich and resinous, with dried fruits and sherry!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 23 Year Old - 1973 Rare Malts 59.7%
DESCRIPTION:
This Rare Malts expression of 1973 vintage Royal Lochnagar was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.7%, this limited edition 23-year-old single malt was distilled in 1997.  The Royal Lochnagar distillery is situated close to Balmoral, the Queen’s official residence in Scotland.
 
This is bottle number 3998.

This bottling of the Speyside malt from The Balvenie is exclusive to travel retail market. 
There are other bottles in the triple cask range 12 & 16 year old versions but this is the oldest of them all at a great 25 years old. 
Presented in a stunning case with a bronzed plaque and approved by David Stewart.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
Bottle 7.

This eyecatching Macallan Replica was modelled on a bottle from the Victorian era. This is the second release in the Replica range and is said to be inspired by the discovery of two pre-20th century casks of Macallan. It is rich in summer fruits, both fresh/citric and dried, with traces of spice. Light vanilla fudge, sweet oak and wood spice.  This bottle comes in a presentation box, with a stunning red velvety lining.

The 1861 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan which was released before the 1874 reproductions.
These antique pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Millburn - 25 Year Old - Rare Malts Selection
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Highland Malt is a great example of what the series represents.
This Millburn 25-Year-Old single malt was distilled in 1975 and bottled in October 2001, at its natural cask strength of 61.9% ABV. This is an individually numbered bottle.

This was a very limited release, in late 2018, to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the first Hibiki which was released in 1989.
Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of over ten malts and grains featuring Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita all aged in five types of cask.  It was developed by fourth generation chief blender Shinji Fukuyo with production overseen by third generation master blender and great-grandson of the founder, Shingo Torii.
This limited edition has bottle art inspired by a traditional kimono pattern, embellished with tabane noshi – tied bundles of strips that have long been a symbol of cherished gifts.  As always with Hibiki the bottle always has 24 facets representing the 24 seasons of the Japanese lunar calendar.

This Bladnoch 23 Year Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1977 this Lowland single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.6% in October 2001. 
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.

This Coleburn 21-Year-Old limited edition was bottled for the Rare Malts series. Distilled in 1979 this Speyside single malt was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.4% in October 2000.
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 19 Year Old - 1989 Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1989 at the Macallan distillery, matured in a sherry butt #4122 and then bottled in 2008 by Douglas Laing as part of their Old Malt Cask series. This is one of just 352 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 20 Year Old  - 1997 Palo Cortado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition release from Bunnahabhain. Distilled in Nov 1997, matured for 20 years and a then given a finishing period in casks that once held Palo Cortado sherry. Bottled in April 2018 after nearly two years in the Palo Cortado casks at the cask strength of 54.9%. This is one of 1,620 individually numbered bottles produced.

This bottling of the Speyside malt from The Balvenie is exclusive to travel retail market. 
There are other bottles in the triple cask range 12 & 16 year old versions but this is the oldest of them all at a great 25 years old. 
Presented in a stunning case with a bronzed plaque and approved by David Stewart.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
It was matured in refill sherry casks that were previously used for Uigeadail and bottled at 56.7%.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Inish Turk Bee is a Wild Island in the Atlantic off the west coast of Ireland in County Mayo. The 'poitin' cask from which this bottle is from was sent off to age by Cooley Distillery to the Wild Island before being bottled and called Maiden Voyage as this is the first bottling they have offered outside their shores.

DESCRIPTION:

Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the Night’s Watch guard.

This 30 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island & Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilvan Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whisky is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV
Bannow Island 1.1 is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

This lot comes with a Macallan, Glencairn glass.
The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Bowmore is one of only 564 bottles that were released for Feis file 2018. 
"A journey into joy"

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1988 18 3/5 Year Old - Lunar Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
This 18 year old Highland Park, named The Lunar Bottling as it was inspired by the cycle of the moon (the Lunar Nutation) which takes 18 3/5 years. Distilled in 1988, the single malt was aged for 18 3/5 years, then bottled in 2006 at 45.1% ABV. 
This is one of just 500 bottles.

This s and old-style bottling of the Macallan Sherry Oak 12-Year-Old which forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 45.7% ABV is estimated to have been bottled in the early 2000s.  
It comes with a striking, wooden presentation box.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

Distilled in 1991, this 24-year-old whiskey from Teeling was aged initially in bourbon barrels before being finished in Sauternes casks. Made with a small amount of peated malt, this is a subtly sweet whiskey with notes of ripe fruit and a hint of smoke.  The vintage reserve collection is a limited bottling with only 5000 bottles being in circulation. 
The Teeling Whisky Co. believe in continuing the evolution of Irish Whiskey by creating new and unique expressions.

Finish - Lingering wood spice. ginger and clove.

This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 3990.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.

A cracking expression from Bunnahabhain at 25 years of age.
This is one of the newer releases with this age statement and is just a little bit stronger.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask (with sample)
DESCRIPTION:
A bottle your own! This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No1 Valuts on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
This is bottle number 275.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 4107.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.

The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Auchrosik was distilled in 1974 and bottled 28 years later in April 2003 at the natural cask strength of 56.8%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

Bottled in 1996 to mark and celebrate the a milestone for Jack Daniel's. 1996 was the 200th Anniversary for the state of Tennessee. 
Jack Daniel's designed a bottle 100 years earlier and this is a replica for the anniversary celebration.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
Bottle 4923

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

This bottling is a follow on from the very popular Tun 1401 series by The Balvenie Distillery, which had 9 batches.
Due to the success of Tun 1401, Balvenie used a bigger tun - Tun 1509 could hold four times as much liquid.  Seven European oak Sherry butts and thirty-five American oak barrels were used and were married together for several months each.  This bottle also comes with a diagram that details the main tasting characteristics of each of these 43 casks. 
This is the first batch of Balvenie's Tun 1509 single malt Scotch whisky.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

One of only 950 bottles in the Batch 1 Small Batch release was put into 1st fill bourbon barrels impart sweet flavours of vanilla and caramel alongside a creamy texture and were then put into previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020.
 
This is bottle number 86.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 16 Year Old 1990 Limited Edition Sherry Matured
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at 16 year old at cask strength, this was and still is a very popular limited edition from Bowmore on Islay.
Made from Sherry casks and bottled at cask strength. This special bottling was distilled in 1990.

This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 4839.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Smugglers' Series - Volume One - The Illicit Stills
DESCRIPTION: The first in the series Smugglers' Series (of 3 volumes) from the Arran distillery. Matured in a mix of port pipes, sherry hogsheads and ex-bourbon casks using lightly peated, heavily peated and unpeated malt. The Illicit Stills is a limited release of just 8,700 bottles, which pays homage to The Isle of Arran's past, as it was infamous for the production and smuggling of illicit whisky during the 18th & 19th centuries.

One of only 950 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 15 Year Old Spirit of Speyside 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Glenfiddich 1995 1st Fill Bourbon Barrel bottled for the Spirit of Speyside 2018.
Each label is hand written for the 199 bottles produced from this exclusive hand-fill bottling at the Glenfiddich distillery in 2018.
1995 was the year of distilation and matured in a single 1st fill bourbon barrel (cask number #15836).
The whisky was chosen by Glenfiddich's Malt Master, Mr Brian Kinsman.
Bottle 47.

Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

Bottled by John Crabbie in Leith comes the Crabbie 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
Only 247 of these bottles were produced from a single sherry cask.
Note...this is not ginger beer...

This Bowmore 1990 vintage is a limited edition, matured in sherry casks and released at the natural cask strength of 53.8%.   The first of what has become a series of successful cask-strength Bowmore vintage releases.

1883 production started creating mostly lightly peated malts. 
Twenty five years have been sent maturing in order to create different layers within this single malt.
The Margadale spring is said to create Bunnahabhains unique character.

An Old Pulteney single cask from the Scottish Highlands distilled in 1983. 
This limited edition has been matured for a minimum of 21 years.
Until recently Old Pulteney held the record for the most northern distillery on the Mainland UK. It is now held by Wolfburn distillery and even they might lose the title to Thurso...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Devil's Cask Inspired Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask was released exclusively to the travel retail market.
1litre is size, this limited edition is a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is a marriage of finest Oloroso Sherry and Wine Casks.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

This Macallan 12 Year Old Elegancia was matured in both Oloroso and Fino sherry casks. 
Originally released to the travel retail market, it was typically found in duty-free.  This bottling is 1 Litre in size.

Daftmill Summer Batch distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2018.
Daftmill is grown, distilled, matured and bottled in the Kingdom of Fife.
Only 1665 bottles have been produced by the Cuthbert family. When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this beautiful malt.

Lagavulin 1993 Distillers Edition was double matured and was bottled in 2009 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.
Batch No. lgv.4/497

A 15-Year-Old Bowmore matured exclusively in sherry butts and bottled at the cask strength of 54.4%. This is one of 15000 bottles produced.  The bottling has been named 'Laimrig' which is Gaelic for 'Pier' and the bottling celebrates Bowmore's stone pier. This bottle is part of batch 2 in the Laimrig series.
 
This is bottle number 09701

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

Daftmill Summer Batch distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2018.
Daftmill is grown, distilled, matured and bottled in the Kingdom of Fife.
Only 1665 bottles have been produced by the Cuthbert family. When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this beautiful malt.

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Elgin - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This Glen Elgin 12-year-old single malt is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson. This bottling has been discontinued and is no longer available from Diageo's Flora and Fauna series.  It is becoming increasingly hard to find.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 24 Year Old - 1993 Single Sherry Butt #55
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 15th of January 1993 and bottled in 2017 from single sherry butt #55. Matured for 24 years and then bottled at 56.7%. This is one of 567 bottles drawn and is part of  Batch 16 of The GlenDronach Cask Releases

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
Bottle number 547.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 19 Year Old - The Edge of Burnhead Wood
DESCRIPTION: The Edge of Burnhead Wood is the fourth release in Balvenie's Stories range.  This edition celebrates the story of how Malt Master David Stewart made the perfect match between heather and barley.

'Loki' is the second part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection.  It was released in 2013. 
Loki is Thor's adoptive brother and known as the trickster - Highland Park have tried to match this 15 year old single malt to his personality.  It comes with a striking display stand and is one of 21,000 bottles produced.

This release is part of Glenmorangie's limited edition vintage series.
They were bottled in different years and this particular edition was distilled in bottled in 1996 and distilled in 1979.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 16 Year Old Port Matured 1991 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore was matured solely in a Port Cask and if you ask us, it gives a sherry cask a run for its money!
16 years later it was bottled and at cask strength.53.1%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 16 Year Old 1985 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION: This is a beautifully presented limited edition single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in 1985, matured in a sherry butt #1585 for 16 years and was bottled at 51.9% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 16 Year Old 1986 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION: This is a beautifully presented limited edition single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in 1986, matured in a sherry butt #3065 for 16 years and was bottled at 54.9% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony - Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

This 24-year-old GlenDronach is part of The GlenDronach single cask bottlings series.   This is from the 1993 vintage and was bottled in 2017 after being matured in Sherry Butt number 567 for 24 years.  This is one of just 467 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 136.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 22 Year Old - 1994 Single PX Cask #3379
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in November 1994 and bottled in 2017 from single PX cask #3379. Matured for 22 years and then bottled at 49.9%. This is one of 456 individually numbered bottles released as part of Batch 15 single casks, launched in 2017.
This is bottle number 438.

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION: This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.

One of only 950 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020.
 
This is bottle number 63.

Very rare that these bottles come up at auction from White Horse distillers on Islay. Complete with the bakelite screw cap with branded lead foil capsule. No quantity stated on the bottle.
This is a very famous bottle which contains a high proportion of liquids from Lagavulin, other Islay malts and the Glenlivet district.  This comes from the original recipe in 1746. 
By appointment of her majesty the Queen!

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.
A well-aged, undisclosed single Highland malt scotch whisky.  Distilled 1987, matured for 32 years and bottled 2019 by Maltbarn.  This is one of just 159 bottles.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

Bottled by John Crabbie in Leith comes the Crabbie 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
Only 247 of these bottles were produced from a single sherry cask.
Note...this is not ginger beer...

Bottled at 16 year old at cask strength, this was and still is a very popular limited edition from Bowmore on Islay.
It was made up of 134 casks, the majority of which were ex-bourbon and distilled in 1989.

This release is part of Glenmorangie's limited edition vintage series.
They were bottled in different years and this particular edition was distilled in bottled in 1996 and distilled in 1979.

This Bowmore 1989 vintage is a limited edition, produced from 134 casks and released at the natural cask strength of 51.8%.   The first of what has become a series of successful cask-strength Bowmore vintage releases.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenAllachie - 19 Year Old 2000 PX Hogshead #6248 (With Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour. 
Bottle 271.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 25 Year Old - 1993 Single Cask Oloroso #416
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 23rd of March 1993 and bottled in 2019 from single oloroso sherry butt #416. Matured for 25 years and then bottled at 51.2%. This is one of 662 bottles drawn from the cask and was released as part of batch #17 - one of seven domestic releases.

Bottled by John Crabbie in Leith comes the Crabbie 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
988 of these bottles were produced after the brand was revived in 2018.
Note...this is not ginger beer...

This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.
A limited-edition Bowmore, bottled at the cask strength of 55.4% for Feis Ile 2012.  Matured in hand-selected Spanish sherry casks in Bowmore's legendary No.1 Vaults.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old Devil's Cask Inspired Small Batch II
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask is a limited edition and incorporates a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is from the finest first fill Sherry casks.
This is the second edition of the bottling.
This 2007 Fèis Ìle Bottling was distilled in February 2000.  It was matured in a fresh Sherry cask in Warehouse No.5 for 7 years. This is one of just 700 bottles released.

Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 29-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the 2019 Special Releases. Double matured in PX and Oloroso seasoned casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 51.4%. Limited to only 5568 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 22 Year Old - That Boutique-y Whisky Co. - Batch #16
DESCRIPTION: This Springbank single malt was bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. This is one of just 987 bottles produced in Batch 16. The label features Neil Ridley and Joel Harrison off of World's Best Spirits working the old Porteus Mill at Springbank.

Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 28-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the 2018 Special Releases. It was matured in refill American-oak hogsheads and bottled at the cask strength of 52.1%. Limited to only 4860 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 2211.

This bottling comes in a beautifully presented presentation box. It was matured in mostly first fill sherry seasoned casks and of course, spent at least 25 years in the casks. 
A small note from Edrington stated - 
"Edrington is proud to support the Beatson Cancer Charity by donating The Glenrothes 25 Year Old. 
The Glenrothes 25 Year Old is the pinnacle of The Glenrothes Soleo Collection. Matured in a high proportion of first-fill sherry seasoned oak casks and bottled at natural colour, this expression delivers heady notes with a character defined by salted caramel, mango and coriander seeds. The Glenrothes 25 Year Old is an award-winning dram which is best served neat to let the extraordinary taste shine through."

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 20 Year Old - The Explorers Series - Brodick Bay - Vol.1
DESCRIPTION:
'Brodick Bay' is Volume 1 in The Aaron Malt 'Explorer Series' which is a collection of limited edition expressions from the Arran Distillery. Each edition celebrates the outstanding scenic beauty and diversity of nature on the Isle of Arran.
This 20 year old single malt has been matured in both Bourbon Barrels and Sherry Hogsheads before being finished in Oloroso Sherry Butts sourced directly from Bodegas Tradicion in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.
The presentation tin and the bottle label features a beautiful view from the foothills south of Brodick Bay.  This is one of 9000 bottles.

This single malt was released by Glenmorangie in 2013 as part of their prestigious  Private Edition range - this was the 4th release in the series. 
Bottled in 2012 and distilled in 1993 the Ealanta was matured fully in virgin American white oak casks. These casks were special due to their heavily charred oak which came from a forest in Missouri. This is how it largely differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured opposed to just finished in 'designer' casks.
Awards include:

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Screen print Label (1980s)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This 12-year-old bottling from the 1980s era, this Highland Park bottle is screen-printed.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

It is estimated that this is a 1980s bottling of Glenesk 12 year old by from owners Sanderson and Sons Ltd.  It has become increasingly popular due to the fact that this Highland distillery closed in 1985. This is a 75cl bottling.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

Old Pulteney 21 Year Old is a perfect marriage of ex-bourbon casks, ex-Oloroso sherry casks, second fill American oak and some Spanish oak first fill. It was 
Old Pultney is known as the Maritime Malt due to the distillery location at the very North of Scotland and this is honoured with the unique shape of the bottle.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

This is the 2016 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn from refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.
Bottle number 5564

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

A beautiful expression from an independent bottler from the Glenglassaugh distillery.
It was distilled on the 11th July 1984 and matured for 22 years before being released as part of the  Exclusive Malts range.
328 bottles were produced from cask 224.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Boxed
DESCRIPTION:
By far one of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings.
This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is, of course, the only Islay bottle in the collection which helps add to how rare it is.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 17 Year Old Warehousemen's Selection Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Only available from one of the most iconic Islands in Scotland, Islay. This is the last in the craftsmen collection. It was distilled on the 14th of June 1999 and bottled 17 years later, 3000 bottles were produced from a mixture of Bourbon, Sherry and Wine Casks.
Bottle #12.

Possibly one of the rarer bottlings in the Flora & Fauna series, this Balmenach is 12 year old comes presented in a wooden box. This bottle has since been discontinued since the sale of the distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.
Bottle number 58

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 11. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 29-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the 2019 Special Releases. Double matured in PX and Oloroso seasoned casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 51.4%. Limited to only 5568 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 0250.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
Bottle 39

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

Headquartered in Tokyo, The Nikka Whisky company is a producer of great Japanese whisky. A number of different Japanese distilleries are under its umbrella including Yoichi & Hokkaido. Meanwhile...back in Scotland, they also own Ben Nevis distillery. This blended malt is named in honour of Masataka Taketsuru, the father of Japanese whisky. He is the first Japanese who mastered whisky making in Scotland and brought his expertise back to Japan.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

'Organic' was released as part of Bruichladdich's / Octomore Futures collection.  The single malt was distilled in on 09/11/2004 using Optic barley and aged in bourbon casks for until April 2011. This is an individually numbered bottle.
Bottle number 1686.

A special release for the Lagavulin 2015 Jazz Festival. This bottling is a vatting of refill American Oak Casks and European Oak Bodega Casks.  This was a limited edition release of individually numbered bottles bottled at the cask strength of 55.4%.
Bottle number 3111.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 13 Year Old - 2004 Duty Paid Sample - Bottled 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling of Springbank 13-year-old is a Duty Paid Sample intended for trade purposes. 
Bottled from rotation 558 in Warehouse 7, this single malt was distilled on the 26th November 2004.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through aging, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

Bruichladdich specifically released 1,881 bottles of High Noon to align with their official date of establishment in 1881. This is the last Feis Ile bottling from Jim McEwan before his retirement in July 2015. It is a culmination of his Black Arts journey - it is said that the combined age of the casks used is 134 years.
This bottle has been signed by Jim McEwan, Head Distiller, Bruichladdich.
Bottle 753 of 1881.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

DESCRIPTION: A 18-Year-Old blend that is a fusion of Japanese and Scottish malt, in celebration of Thomas Glover - a Scotsman that moved to Japan and set up The Japan Brewery Company and the company that would become Mitsubishi.  This is one of 1406 bottles.

A rare vintage bottling distilled in 1974 and bottled in 1992 by Ledaig distillery. 
Ledaig stared in 1972 and sought after, even more so if it from the early 70s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old - Sherry Cask Selection - Aberlour Village Bicentenary
DESCRIPTION:
Aberlour bicentenary, bottled especially to celebrate 200th anniversary of the founding of Aberlour village. Matured for 12 years in sherry casks before being bottled at cask strength in 2012. 
 
This is bottle number 1812 of 1812!

10 Year Old Glenfarclas 105...very, very popular among the masses especially at cask strength. 
Can you imagine how this 20 Year Old was first received when it was first released after spending a further 10 years in the cask and is still bottled at 60%!!
Brilliant!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 16 Year Old - Bordeaux Wine Cask 1992
DESCRIPTION:
This 1992 vintage Bowmore was matured in Bordeaux wine casks.
Bottles after 16 years at the cask strength of 53.5%.

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

From the Indy bottler Adelphi comes this Islay malt that was distilled in 2010 at Caol Ila distillery.
Only 306 bottles were produced of the stunning 8-year-old.

An old bottling of Ardbeg 10-year-old which was bottled in 2003 - this release features an ‘Introducing’ stripe across the top right of the box - meaning that it is from the original release of whisky after the distillery reopened in 1997.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 27 Year Old 1992 Dramfool "Malt Can Heal"
DESCRIPTION:
The 29th release from the Indy bottler Dramfool comes from the Speyside distillery Macallan. It was distilled in 1992 and named "Malt Can Heal". This 27 year old is one of only 247 bottles produced.
Great job Bruce once again!

Bottled in 2015, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in bourbon barrels.
It's said to have a palate resembling macerated plums, crushed almonds and pecan cake.
Bottled at cask strength.

Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour.

This limited edition Miyagikyo sherry wood finished single malt was released in 2018. 
Miyagikyo distillery produces a refined malt whisky with a signature fruity and floral freshness.

The most established distillery on Islay, Bowmore was founded in 1779.
If you have ever been lucky enough to be on Islay and more specifically Bowmore at Dawn, you will know it certainly is a magical place, much like this dram. It has been partially finished in casks which previously held Ruby Port.

This is the second release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series.  It contains whisky drawn from just 50 sherry butts to craft a rich and fruity dram. 
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.
Bottle 242.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

The Keystones Series 2nd release, from Highland Park, Shiel.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The shovels, made of wood, that are used to turn the barley is where the name Shiel originates.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.
Bottle 148.

This Glengoyne 15 Year Old Pure Malt Scotch Whisky, comes in unusually presented in a kiln decanter with a pagoda top stopper.  Distilled, matured and bottled by Lang Brothers Ltd. Estimate to have been bottled in the 1980s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ki Noh Bi - Karuizawa Cask-Aged Gin - 3rd Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The world of Japanese gin meets the world of Japanese whisky.
 This release is from Kyoto Distillery's Ki No Bi Gin range - 3rd edition.  The gin has been aged in sherry casks that were previously used to mature whisky from the legendary Karuizawa distillery

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare bottling of Clynelish, which is part of the Flora and Fauna series.  This bottling has now discontinued.
Because of its popularity, it ended up having a spin-off for its own line of single malt whisky.

A limited-edition bottling of single malt from the Arran distillery to celebrate their 21st anniversary! The whisky used was distilled during the first three years of their production, matured in Sherry hogsheads. This is one of 5,988 bottles produced.

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

This is one of 332 bottles.
Bottle 59.

This single cask Port Charlotte was bottled by Hunter Laing and released by Dramfool for the 2019 Feis Ile.  Aged for 14 years in a 1st fill sherry hogshead.
One of just 299 bottles.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

Knochdhu distillery has produced fine malt whisky since 1894. With this limited edition of Cask Strength, 21 year old Knochdhu have created a single malt whisky of uncommon distinction.
This bottle is 57.5% ABV.

This company previously owned Caol Ila distillery from 1863 until the early 1920s. This leads us to believe that Bulloch Lade Gold label has a very high content of the Islay malt. 
Note the spring cap...an early release indeed.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 6.3 - 5 Year Old-  2009 - Islay Barley
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2014, Octomore 06.3 Islay Barley was made with barley grown on Islay from 'Lorgba' field on Octomore Farm.  This limited edition 2009, is true to the character of Bruichladdich's Octomore expressions - it is very heavily peated with 258 PPM.  It is a very flavoursome 5 year old single malt, created with depth, elegance and a tasty dose of peat!

This is one of 332 bottles.
This is bottle number 223.

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

This is the second release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series.  It contains whisky drawn from just 50 sherry butts to craft a rich and fruity dram. 
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1690 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 047/2007, 048/2007, 049/2007, 051/2007, 051/2007, 052/2007 and 053/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2020.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenAllachie - 13 Year Old (2005) - Single Cask #901037 - Hand-Fill
DESCRIPTION:
This GlenAllachie single cask was hand bottled in September 2019. It is a 2005 vintage sherry butt matured whisky.  This is an individually numbered bottle. 
 
 
Bottle 633.

Mannochmore 2018 Manager's Dram is highly sought after for most collectors as the series goes on, year on year.
Bottled at it's natural strength of 58% this was specially selected by Annelise Hastings.

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

This 30-year-old is an excellent blend by Ballantines and is well recognised as an outstanding whisky. It won a Gold at the International Spirits Challenge and an ISC Trophy (the second in four years), was named as Category Champion for Blended Scotch Whisky and Jim Murray gave it 92 points.

This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain is extremely limited and is one of just 564 bottles produced. 
It was bottled in June 2017 and before this, it was matured in a Sicilian Marsala wine cask for 4 years.
 
Bottle 456.

From the North side of the island, Bunnahabhain is famous for its hand filled bottlings. This exciting lot contains the following - 
11 Year Old Manzanilla - Number 3212 - 54.2%
12 Year Old Palo Cortado - Number 17 - 55.6%
12 Year Old Palo Cortado - Number 16 - 55.7%
14 Year Old Moine PX Finish - Number ARI3000002 - 53.2%
12 Year Old - Oloroso - 56.4%

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.
This is a 26-Year-Old single cask Glentauchers - Glenlivet matured in a bourbon barrel.  This is one of only 108 bottles produced, bottled at the cask strength of 51.6% in Autumn 2017 by Cadenhead's.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old - Cuvee 382 - La Berenice
DESCRIPTION: This 21 Years Old Bruichladdich single malt was initially matured in bourbon-cask with additional cask evolution in Limousin oak casks previously used to hold Sauternes and Barsac sweet wines.

The Macallan Fine Oak 17 Years Old is part of the Macallan Fine Oak range.  It has been matured for a minimum of seventeen years in three oak cask types including American and European ex-oloroso sherry and American oak bourbon casks. It was introduced to the US market in 2006.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenAllachie - 19 Year Old 2000 PX Hogshead #6248 (With Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at the natural cask strength of 52.5% this is an exclusive for The Whisky World. It was distilled in April of the Millenium and bottled at 19 years old in March 2020...very close to a 20 year old!
The story for this bottling is complex, it was first stored in a American Standard Barrel/Refill Bourbon cask and then transferred to a PX Hogshead. 
This dram was transferred into its new cask under the careful guidance of Billy Walker for at least 2 years which gives it a great finish/colour. 
Bottle number 272.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.
A Speyside single malt from Benromach aged 18 year old which was bottled by Hart Brothers.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

For many, it was a great disappointment when this favourite was discontinued in January 2007.
Bowmore is hugely popular all around the world and seen by many as the best Islay malt of them all, especially at cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
Bottle 1188

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 16 year Old Heavily Peated Feis 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This super heavily peated malt is the oldest release in the series. It was distilled in 2003 and Bruoichladdich used only Scottish barely. Only 3000 bottles were produced at 55.8% Abv. 
Casks used -
Refill Hogshead - Then recasked to bourbon barrels in 2012.
Firstfill Bourbon Barrels - Then recasked into ex-Sauternes casks in 2013.
Ex Sherry / Ex Bourbon and Virgin Oak.

Distilled in December 2005 and peated to 167ppm.  The spirit was put into 1st fill Bourbon and Grenache Blanc casks.
The next ten years were spent maturing in P2, in Port Charlotte, which is close to the shore of Loch Indaal.
This second edition is limited to 18,000 individually numbered bottles, presented at 57.3% abv. with a splash of Islay spring water.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020

One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2004 Moine Port Pipe Finish - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain was limited to just 1596 bottles, released for the Feis Ile 2017.
Distilled in December 2004 it was matured in refill hogshead casks, then finished in Moine Port Pipes.  It was bottled in March 2017 at 55.6%. 
 
Bottle number 46.

This is a 1L bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 06/12/2018 this is one of only 612 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - Moine Px - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This 12-Year-Old Bunnahabhain limited edition was released for Feis Ile 2016 and exclusively available from the distillery. Matured in Moine casks for 9 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez casks for 3 years. This is one of only 833 individually numbered bottles.
 
 
 
This is bottle number #309.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - Moine Px - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This 12-Year-Old Bunnahabhain limited edition was released for Feis Ile 2016 and exclusively available from the distillery. Matured in Moine casks for 9 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez casks for 3 years. This is one of only 833 individually numbered bottles.
 
 
 
This is bottle number 787.

This New Make Spirit from Bimber Distillery is part of Batch 177/2020 was produced to meet the high levels of interest from enthusiasts for exploring Bimber’s light and fruity spirit character before it begins its maturation journey. Bottled at ‘filling strength’ of 63.5% ABV and were released as a distillery exclusive.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

This Bunnahabhain started life in 2005 in whisky refill casks, before being transferred into Palo Cortado casks on 30/07/2015 to rest for a little longer in the coastal warehouses before being bottled as a distillery exclusive.
Palo Cortado is a rare type of sherry that started as a Fino or an Amontillado. During the ageing process, the flor becomes damaged or dies off, which leads to the sherry ageing oxidatively, giving it some of the sweeter characteristics more common in Oloroso sherry.
Only 624 bottles were available at the distillery and online shop.
Most certainly worth having in the collection!
Bottle 7

This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks  for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.
A green, ceramic decanter of Glen Garioch 21 Year Old produced by Buchan Thistle Ceramics.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 16 Year Old - Amontillado - Feis Ile 2016
DESCRIPTION:
A 16-Year-Old Bunnahabhain exclusively sold at the distillery during Feis Ile 2016.  Matured in Bourbon casks for 10 years then finished in Amontillado casks for six years. This is a very limited one of only 250 bottles.
This is bottle number 90.

Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.
Bottle number 708.
