Glenglassaugh 21 Year Old is a 46% ABV bottling from the Highland distillery which reopened in 2008.
This is presented in an elegant teardrop bottle.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.
Bottle 1011

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 21 Year Old - 1992 Single Oloroso Cask #270
DESCRIPTION:
A 21-year-old single cask Oloroso Sherry butt matured Glendronach.
Distilled in June 1992 and bottled March 2014 from cask #270.
This is one of only 648 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 606.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North Port - Brechin - 1982 G&M Connoisseur Choice
DESCRIPTION:
From the closed distillery, this single malt was distilled in 1982 and bottled in 2008 to be part of the Gordon & Macphail Connoisseurs Choice range.
It has been matured in a refill sherry cask.

'Ledaig' represents peated single malt from the Tobermory distillery. This Ledaig Limited Edition is 21 Year Old was finished in Manzanilla sherry casks.  This is obe of 1602 individually numbered bottles.
 
This is bottle number 1184

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Devil's Cask - Batch III - Double the Devil
DESCRIPTION: The third and final appearance of The Devil's Casks from Bowmore.  Deemed ' Double the Devil' Batch 3 combines the features of the previous two releases. Matured in both Pedro Ximénez and oloroso sherry casks.

This is the 2019 Diageo Special Release of Cardhu 14-Year-Old.  The label & box feature a bee in line with the overarching theme of the Diageo Special Release 2019 series  'Rare by Nature'.  Double matured in ex-Amontillado hogsheads, bottled at 14 years old with at 55% ABV. This is one of the 4,860 bottles produced.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2013 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon and port wood casks to create an exceptional balance of their signature peat flavour with tangy citrus fruits and a floral finish.
It was bottled at 51.3% ABV.

This Mortlach 16 year old single malt is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson. This bottling has been discontinued and is no longer available from Diageo's Flora and Fauna series.  It is becoming increasingly hard to find.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.

This single cask Craigellachie was distilled in September 1995 and was bottled in November 2015 at 20 Years Old by Hunter Laing & Company Ltd, for their Old Malt Cask range.   This is one of 360 bottles from sherry butt #HL12112. Bottled at 50% ABV.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
Bottle 2839.

Due to the cancellation of Fèis Ìle 2020, this year's Kilchoman festival release was an online exclusive and is one of just 2630 bottles available.  Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for a minimum of 12 years and bottled at the cask strength (54.2%).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 9 Year Old 2007 Fresh Sauternes Hogshead
DESCRIPTION: Picked by Findlay Ross, the GM of Springbank distillers in Campbeltown, this is a 9 year old dram, bottled at cask strength. It was distilled in 2007 and later bottled in 2017 from a Fresh Sauternes Hogshead.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 8 Year Old 2007 Fresh Sherry Butt
DESCRIPTION: Selected by distillery manager Gavin Mclachlan, this 8 year old single malt is from Springbank in Campbeltown. It matured in a fresh sherry butt for 8 years and only 594 bottles were available. Bottled in 2016 at cask strength 57.2%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 13 Year Old - Distillery Exclusive - Sherry Cask
DESCRIPTION: This Aberlour 13 Year Old is a hand filled bottling from the Speyside distillery. The single malt was matured for 13 years in an Oloroso Sherry Cask. Bottled at 57.4%. Comes in a wooden presentation box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benrinnes - 13 Year Old 2006 - Adelphi (RAF Benevolent Fund)
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask was selected by Alex Bruce, grandson of Edward James Bruce for the RAF Benevolent Fund. £5 from the original sale was donated to the charity. 
Distilled in 2006, this 13-Year-old botted in 2019 at the natural cask strength of 56.5%.  This is one of only 319 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 210.

This single cask Dalmore was distilled in 1995 and released exclusively for Dalmore distillery in 2012 at their highland home.
This expression was matured in a bourbon cask before being finished in a Matusalem Olosoro sherry cask.
Cask #200 yielded only 650 bottles from which this is one.

A classic from the independent bottler Gordon and MacPhail's.
This Macallan is part of the Speymalt range, it was bottled in 2017 but was distilled in 1998.  Gordon & MacPhail purchased the Macallan new-make spirit to be matured in their own oak casks.

This bottle is one of no more than 350 bottles drawn from the single cask number #1301. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
Distilled on 27.08.83 and bottled 13.9.99.

Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.
Islay Mist 8 Year Old - including Laphroaig Single Malt. Islay Mist retains the smoky flavour of Laphroaig whilst offering a beautiful softness.

DESCRIPTION: This whisky has been reserved by the distillery and has been aged in Oak casks. A classic decanter containing 18 year old Glenfiddich, produced by Spode.

One of 204 bottles this Glenburgie was distilled in 1992.
It has been matured in a Bourbon Hogshead for 25 years and bottled in 2018.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional with both expressions adding up to 65 years of maturation. Presented in a stunning case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.
40 Year Old - 46% ABV, 5cl.

The Macallan Rare Cask is comprised of 16 different sherry-cask styles, the majority of which are first fill.  Rich and complex with notes of dark honey and dried fruit, this bridges the gap between The 1824 Series and The 1824 Collection.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.
This discontinued Longmorn was bottled after being matured in oak casks for 15 years in the heart of the Scottish Highands.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Of Glen Ord - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram 2016
DESCRIPTION: A 16-year-old Single malt from Glen Ord, specially selected by malt distillery managers within Diageo Distillery Ltd and bottled at natural cask strength. This is the 2016 Edition.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was launched in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2002 Spanish Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2002, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 15 years - it was initially aged in whisky refill cask and then in 2013 it was allowed a finishing period in Spanish oak Gran Reserva casks.  This was a limited release of just 1500 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.
Bottle number 0133.
This limited edition Bunnahabhain distillery was fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks, revealing a side of the distillery not often seen. It has been bottled at the cask strength of 60.1 % ABV.

Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 12 Year Old - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2742.

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

Bottled for Feis Ile 2017, this is a combination of 12 different casks from Port Charlotte's heavily peated malts.
Only 1000 bottles were produced and all have a unique code which you can look up the recipe online.
Bottle 216 of 1000.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 1991 16 Year Old - Cask Strength - Chivas Brothers
DESCRIPTION: This 16-year-old Glenlivet was distilled in 1991 and bottled by Chivas Brothers in 2008 at Cask Strength. This bottle is from batch number GL16008.

Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.
Bottle 1239.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 21 Year Old - The Explorers Series - Lochranza Castle - Vol. 2
DESCRIPTION: This is Volume 2 of The Arran Explorers Series. Each edition celebrates the outstanding scenic beauty and diversity of nature on the Isle of Arran. This 21-year-old and has been matured in Sherry Hogsheads before being finished in Amontillado Sherry Casks sourced directly from Bodegas Tradicion in Jerez De La Frontera, Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Loch Dhu  - 10 Year Old - The Black Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
This Black malt is of divided opinion in the whisky community. The origin of its dark nature is either one of a fairytale or simply caramel colouring.
Produced at Mannochmore there is no doubt, with this whisky becoming increasing hard to find, it is becoming very collectable.

One of the earliest releases in a wood finish from the Highland distillery Glenmorangie. It was released in the early 1990's (93/94) at two strengths... 46.8% & 46.5%.
This is the 46.5% version and this bottling is rarely seen at auction. The Master of wood in Glenmorangie continued this success and they are well known for their experimental wood finishes.

Sienna is a no age statement bottling, released as part of the sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan.
Matured in top quality sherry casks, this single malt is named Sienna to represent the naturally occurring pigment - referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Devil's Cask - Batch III - Double the Devil
DESCRIPTION: The third and final appearance of The Devil's Casks from Bowmore.  Deemed ' Double the Devil' Batch 3 combines the features of the previous two releases. Matured in both Pedro Ximénez and oloroso sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Ryder Cup 2014
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ryder Cup Edition which took place in Gleneagles 2014 where Europe thrashed America by 16½ points to 11½, for their third consecutive victory.
Diageo used to own the hotel in Gleneagles and have a bar there dedicated to Johnnie Walker. This hotel has since been taken over.
This Chivas Regal 25 year old is a delicious blend, with notes of peach and almond. It comes in a striking presentation box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 13 Year Old - Distillery Exclusive - Sherry Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This Aberlour 13 Year Old is a hand filled bottling from the Speyside distillery. The single malt was matured for 13 years in an Oloroso Sherry Cask. Bottled at 57.4%. Comes in a wooden presentation box.
This is bottle number 321.

One of only 297 bottles, this Caol Ila was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2020. 
The famous badge graces this bottle from Adelphi...Malt does more than milton can to justify gods ways to a man.
A.E. Housman

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Legend Limited Edition Donnachie Mhor
DESCRIPTION:
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore. 
The back of this limited edition tin reads -
Legend has it, that long ago in the village of Bowmore, on the Island of Islay, lived an illicit distiller called Donnachie Mhor. He was loved for his good humoured pranks but loathed by the Customs man for his illegal whisky production.
Donnachie's infamous whisky still was old and leaking. Being a poor man he could not afford to replace it but devised a cunning plan. He carried the old still to the nearby peat moor, where it was buried and the spot marked with a sheep's skull.
Some weeks later he met the Customs man in the local Inn. In conversation, Donnachie explained that he had turned over a new leaf and his days of illicit whisky making were gone forever. The Customs man was pleased but suspicious, so to prove his new character, Donnachie volunteered to take the Customs man to where he knew an illegal still was hidden.
At midnight they set out across the peat moor. After much searching they found a sheep's skull and Donnachie suggested they start digging. As they dug through the soft peat they struck the copper still.
The Customs man, delighted with such a find, proudly carried the still back to Bowmore village where he and Donnachie enjoyed a few drams of the Bowmore Malt in celebration. Donnachie was given a handsome reward for reporting the illegal still. The reward enabled Donnachie to purchase a brand new larger illegal still!
Bottles for the travel retail market, this Bowmore has a nose of sea spray and peat smoke. The Bowmore distillery is the oldest established one on Islay. It was founded in 1779.

A blended malt that has been bottled in this nicely presented flagging. The liquid within has been matured for a minimum of 17 years.
Bottled Nordran Mccall.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute LXX 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A special edition bottling of Royal Salute, produced in very limited quantities from whisky aged for at least 21 years (with much older spirit rumoured to be in the blend).

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

'Companta' by Glenmorangie, follows on from 'Ealanta', which was named as World Whisky of the Year 2014 by Jim Murray. 'This Private Edition Companta was a very popular release, selling out quickly from most retailers.
After first maturing in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, the Companta was matured in 60% Burgundy wine casks from Clos de Tart and 40% Rhône Valley casks that previously held Rasteau, sourced by Glenmorangie's Director of Distilling, Dr. Bill Lumsden.
The result is an exceedingly well-made cherry red, non-chill-filtered single malt that fits perfectly into the continuing range of experimental releases from Glenmorangie.

Springbank distillery is unique for a variety of reasons.
1. It's the oldest distillery in Scotland (family owned)
2. 100% of the production and processes are on one site.
3. The largest private employer in Campbeltown. 
This 9 year old dram came from a refill marsala hogshead. Distilled in September 2006 and bottled in May 2016. It is one of only 276 bottles.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
Bottle number 669.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
Bottle number 1363.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range and it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood certainly holds its own in the core range. 
It lives up to its name having an additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes.
Distilled in 1964, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1986 by Justerini & Brooks at 43%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kavalan - Sherry Cask Selection - For The Whisky Exchange
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Sherry matured whisky produced in Taiwan.  This bottle is from a single sherry cask No. #S100125026A, specially selected by The Whisky Exchange. This is one of 526 bottles.
The Taiwanese distillery started production in 2006 and has been decorated with lots and lots of awards ever since. 
This is bottle number 201.

Springbank distillery is unique for a variety of reasons.
1. It's the oldest distillery in Scotland (family owned)
2. 100% of the production and processes are on one site.
3. The largest private employer in Campbeltown. 
This 9 year old dram came from a refill marsala hogshead. Distilled in September 2006 and bottled in May 2016. It is one of only 276 bottles.

Bottled in 2019, this is one of 688 bottles. This Speyside malt comes from a Sherry butt finish after being matured for 20 years.
French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky is to thank for this wonderful expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - Sgeul Na Mara Feis Ile 2013
DESCRIPTION:
A limited released for the Feis Ile 2013 from Bunnahabhain Sgeul Na Mara is Gaelic for 'Tales of the Sea'.
Only 606 bottles were bottled on 19th March 2013 and every bottle was hand signed by Distillery Manager Andrew Brown and Master Distiller Ian MacMillan.
 
This is bottle number 111 of 606

This is a great single pot still whiskey that has been matured in the finest oak cask, creating a harmonious balance of spicy creamy, fruity, sherry and toasted notes.
Redbreast 12 Year Old was impressively named 'Overall Irish Whiskey of the Year' at the 2013 Irish Whiskey Awards.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

From the horses (distilleries) mouth...
THE CASKS:1970s REFILL BOURBON HOGSHEADS: DISTILLED ON 23/02/1973, 10/07/1975 AND 23/09/1977
Tomatin from the 1970’s is held in exceptionally high regard, prized for its depth and complexity. Matured in refill Hogsheads, this malt has taken on very little oak influence which has allowed the air and liquid in the casks to interact and develop a wide array of tropical fruit flavours.
1980sFINISHED IN FIRST FILL OLOROSO SHERRY BUTTS: DISTILLED ON 02/12/1988Tomatin from the 1980’s is sweet and fresh. This malt has been finished for over three years in 1st fill Oloroso Sherry Butts, resulting in a whisky reminiscent of aged Cognac. Tones of aged leather, polished oak and dark roast coffee along with flavours of stone fruit, dark chocolate and tannin add richness.
1990sFIRST FILL BOURBON BARRELS: DISTILLED ON 04/10/1995The use of 1st fill Bourbon Barrels has developed a malt with characteristics of golden syrup, freshly baked pastries with subtle spices and add a layer of warmth. Although well into its twenties, Tomatin from the 1990’s is bold which helps impart long length to the overall finish.
2000s RECHARRED VERDEJO WINE BARRELS: DISTILLED ON 28/01/2000 AND 05/06/2009
From 2000 onwards Tomatin began to experiment with a wider variety of casks. The malt used from the 2000’s has been matured in Verdejo Wine casks which have been re-charred to harness the full influence of the French oak. This adds sweetness as well as some spicier notes.2010s
SECOND FILL FRENCH OAK BARRELS: DISTILLED ON 14/03/2013
Young Tomatin in second fill casks allows the distillery character to shine through. Fresh green fruits and malty characteristics are to the fore with subtle spice and toffee from the light French oak influence. This is a vivacious malt which adds lighter tones but is kept in balance with the older casks.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This is one of 1710 bottles.
Bottle 1454.

225 casks were required to produce this 1991 vintage, 13 Year Old.
It's release celebrated 30 years of service by head cooper, Don Ramsay.
It certainly does him justice after spending 30 plus years working at the distillery.
Thank you Don!

Dartmoor Whisky Distillery, the first single malt whisky distillery in the South West of England.  These bottles are individually numbered within their batch and hand signed by the owners and master distiller, making these bottles highly desirable and rare.  
This bottling was from the first distillation of the new Dartmoor Distillery in Bovey Tracey which was then the first cask released from Dartmoor Distillery, matured in sherry casks. It also comes with a certificate. No more numbered bottled from this cask are available at the distillery.
This is bottle number 158.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Ileach Edition Feis Ile 2011
DESCRIPTION:
In 2011 the Feis Ile festival releases this Cairdeas from Laphroig.
Master Distiller, John Campbell, created the 'Ileach Edition'. He is the first Islay native to be in this position at Laphroaig.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2012 bottling combines some of the original liquid used to create càideas, further matured and complemented with newer Laphroaig spirit that has been fully matured in quarter casks.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

A 15-Year-Old Bowmore was matured exclusively in sherry butts and bottled at cask strength of 50.3%. This is one of just 4500 bottles produced.  The bottling has been named 'Laimrig' which is Gaelic for 'Pier' and the bottling celebrates Bowmore's stone pier.
 
This is bottle 1765 of 4500.

An 18 year old single malt, part of Macallan's Fine Oak range. It has been matured for eighteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This complex combination of casks has created a light amber single malt with tropical flavours balanced with wood smoke.

This is a distillery exclusive bottling from Clynelish Distillery.  It is a limited edition of just 6,000 bottles.  Matured in a bourbon cask, this single malt was personally selected by the distillery team and bottled at 48% ABV.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

This 27-year-old Fettercairn was bottled by independent bottler Signatory Vinatge Scotch Whisky Co. This single cask bottling was distilled in 07/12/1988, matured in hogshead #1996 and was bottled in June 2018.  This is one of just 261 numbered bottles.
 
 
This is bottle number 199.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dufftown - 14 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
From The Manager's Dram range (a series of releases for Diageo staff members featuring whiskies picked out by distillery managers) comes a 14 year old single malt from Dufftown. The label features a golden salmon jumping over a picture of the distillery.
This is bottle number 0664.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.
This is the 2nd release of the 1990 vintage by Balblair. It was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2014 with its natural colour, at 46%.

This First Cask bottling is a Linkwood 19 Year Old single malt. Distilled in 1990 and was matured in single hogshead cask #9728.
This is bottle 140.
This limited edition Bunnahabhain distillery was fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks, revealing a side of the distillery not often seen. It has been bottled at the cask strength of 60.1 % ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis - 21 Year Old - First Cask 1990 # 1504
DESCRIPTION:
This Ben Nevis single cask was bottled for The First Cask series. Distilled on 20th December 1990 and matured in sherry butt #1504 before being bottled at 21 years old.
This is bottle number 380.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 17 Year Old - 2001 Cadenhead's -  Cameron's Choice
DESCRIPTION:
This 17-year-old single cask from Bowmore distillery was bottled by Scotland's oldest independent bottlers, Cadenhead's.
Distilled on in 2001 and matured in a single hogshead for 17 years until it was bottled at 54.2% in May 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old - 2007 - Micro Provenance #1321 - UK Laddie Crew Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This is a limited edition of just 246 individually numbered bottles.  It was matured in 2nd fill Sauternes cask #1321. distilled in July 2007,  it was then bottled in over 10 years later in November 2017 at 63.8% ABV.  This release was exclusive to the UK Laddie Crew, a select group of hand-picked British whisky retailers.

This distillery lies just outside the small town of Buckie in the North East of Scotland. It lay dormant for many years and this bottling represents the first new release following it starting back up again. This is one of ony 650 bottles. 
It was distilled on December 16th 2008 and then bottled in December 2011.

One of the older bottlings from the Lowland distillery. 
This is a 21 year old expression from Glasgow's Auchentoshan distillery.

'Terra' single malt whisky from Macallan’s Quest Collection, is a complex whisky with a distinctive flavour of toffee, dried fruits and rich, woody spices. Aged exclusively in first-fill European and American oak sherry seasoned casks, Terra has a golden amber colour, and aromas of dried fruits, lemon and toffee.

A very rare bottle of Glen Spey 8-year-old from the 1980s. 
This bottling has a cork stopper, opposed to a screw top, making it even more desirable.

To make The Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson specially selected 6 casks of differently aged Dalmore malts matured in wine, Madeira, sherry, marsala, Kentucky bourbon and port casks.  A remarkable feat of blending crafted to honour the act of saving Scotland's King in 1263.  It is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

Produced at Mannochmore there is no doubt, with this whisky becoming increasing hard to find, it is becoming very collectable.

This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

Glenmorangie Traditional is 100 Proof which equates to 57.2% BAV.
A limited edition, this expression was matured for 10 years in mountain oak until being bottled at its natural strength.
Before 1700 the farmers of Ross-shire originally supplied malt whisky to the royal burgh of Tain, the home of Glenmorangie.
Aromas: Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla. honey and citrus fruits.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak - Year of the Dog (2 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
With bespoke label designs, this is an eye-catching limited-edition release twin pack containing 2 x 70cl bottles of The Macallan 12-year-old Double Cask single malt whisky.
The bottles and the presentation box feature artwork celebrating Chinese New Year 2018 (the year of the Dog), the eleventh in the 12-year cycle of the zodiac.
The beautiful illustration is also inspired by the incredible story behind The Macallan’s exceptional oak casks and the extraordinary journey that takes the oak from the forest floor to the distillery in Scotland

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Smugglers' Series - Volume Three - The Exciseman
DESCRIPTION: The third bottling in the Smugglers' Series from the Arran distillery. The single malt was matured in bourbon quarter casks and Madeira casks. This edition "pays tribute to the exuberant character of those striving to outwit the Government’s representatives"!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila  - 20 Year Old 1996 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION:
Only 316 bottles of this single malt scotch whisky have been produced from the Caol Ila distillery, Islay.
Distilled in September 1996 this cask strength expression was aged for 20 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing.
One of 252 bottles, this Strathisla - Glenlivet was distilled in 1997, matured Bourbon Hogshead for 20 years and was bottled in Autumn 2017 by Cadenhead at the natural cask strength of 55.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2008 - Moine French Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of three releases by Bunnahabhain for the 2019 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt was distilled on the February 2008 and was matured for 11 years - it was finished in French Oak before it was bottled at 57.4% ABV in February 2019.  This is a limited edition release of only 1872 bottles produced.
Bunnahabhain is generally regarded as the lighter of the Islay whiskies, although the Moine releases are their heavily peated spirit. This particular example has been finished in French Oak casks.
 
Bottle 1722.

'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

The Keystones Series 4th release, from Highland Park, Yesnaby.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the cliff on the coast of the Islands. Atlantic side.
Cask Info
- First-fill Sherry seasoned American Oak casks.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Smugglers' Series Volume Two - The High Seas
DESCRIPTION: The second bottling in the Smugglers' Series from the Arran distillery. The single malt was matured in a combination of rum casks and first-fill bourbon barrels. This is one of 8,700 produced.

This single cask Craigellachie was distilled in September 1995 and was bottled in April 2017 at 21 Years Old by Hunter Laing & Company Ltd, for their Old Malt Cask range.   This is one of 587 bottles from sherry butt #HL13740. Bottled at 50% ABV.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Feis Ile 2016 - Virgin Oak & Oloroso Sherry
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle was released during Feis Ile 2016. 
It is made with a marriage of four American virgin oak barrels and a 1st fill Oloroso sherry butt. After being married together the spirit was returned to the original casks for a longer period of maturation.  Bottled at a cask strength of 54.9% and limited to only 1500 bottles. 
This is bottle 973.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
This is bottle 1349.

Distilled in 2004 just outside the town of Alness in the highlands, this Dalmore has been matured 10 years in American white oak bourbon barrels.
Whisky auction be clambering...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - Rubha A'Mhail - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION:
Bunnahabhain Rubha A’ Mhail is a 11-year old Bunnahabhain which was bottled for the 2015 Fèis Ìle. Aged in two Spanish Manzanilla sherry butts (#550 & #554) this is a limited edition of 1,200 individually numbered bottles.   
Bottle 160.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old  - Amontillado - Feis Ile 2012
DESCRIPTION:
This very limited-edition  expression was released for Feis Ile 2012.  Matured for 12 years and was finished in Amontillado sherry casks.  This is one of just 346 bottles and is signed by distillery manager Andrew Brown.
 
 
 
 
This is bottle number 133.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 2005 Queen of the Hebridies 1st Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Filled on the 8th of June 2005 in a Sherry Hogshead, this Bruichladdich was matured on Islay. It was bottled on 12th July 2016. Only 305 bottles were produced from this Sherry Oak cask #432/005 in 2019. 
This is the second edition in a 3 part series that holds L Banks, D Wood and S Birchs signature on the label. These gentlemen were huge whisky enthusiast and loved their pilgrimage to the Inner Hebrides. 
While this cask was maturing nicely, Mr Wood could almost smell it as he was distillery manager at Caol Ila distillery.
This well presented 18 year old Jameson was initially aged in ex-bourbon and ex-Oloroso sherry casks.  It was then moved over to first-fill ex-bourbon barrels for a finishing period before bottling.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 18 Year Old Cask Strength Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This cask strength edition is from Speysides Glenlivet and it was only available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Batch number GL18014 and was distilled in Jan 1996 and bottled in August 2014.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood certainly holds its own in the core range. 
It lives up to its name having an additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the first release in the series, released for Feis Ile 2010.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 12 Year Old - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
A 12 year old Caol Ila bottled for the 2017 Feis Ile.  This limited edition was double matured in Amoroso Cask Wood and was bottled at cask strength of 55.8%. This is one of 1,500 individually numbered bottles.
 
Bottle 18

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cragganmore - 15 Year Old 150th Anniversary Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A Cragganmore distillery exclusive bottling to commemorate their 150th anniversary, which was in 2019. It is one of 1869 bottles, which, I don't think is a coincidence matches the year of the distillery's foundation.
This single malt has been double matured in American oak for 15 years.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 14 Year Old Hand Filled 2005 - Cask #530/1930
DESCRIPTION:
A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at cask strength of 60% ABV.
It was distilled on the 15/12/05, aged in a PX sherry puncheon number 1930 and bottled on 4/3/20.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Smugglers' Series Volume Two - The High Seas
DESCRIPTION: The second bottling in the Smugglers' Series from the Arran distillery. The single malt was matured in a combination of rum casks and first-fill bourbon barrels. This is one of 8,700 produced.

Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Nick Veasey No.4 Exceptional Oak Casks.
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition is part of Macallans award-winning 1824 Collection.  It is a delicious single malt layered with fruit and spice crafted by Bob Dalgarno. Released exclusively for Travel Retail only.
This is one of a limited edition of 6 x-ray bones photographed by Nick Veasey, for Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition. This particular bottling celebrates No.4 on their list of the 6 pillars - The exceptional Oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teeling - 13 Year Old - The Revival Volume 2 - Calvados Casks
DESCRIPTION:
The Teeling Whisky Co. believe in continuing the evolution of Irish Whiskey by creating new and unique expressions.
This is the second limited-edition bottling in The Teeling Whisky Co. Revival Commemorative Series.  Volume II, is a 13-Year-Old Single Malt Irish whiskey distilled in 2002.  It was matured for 12 years in ex-Bourbon casks. Then finosed for a further 12 months’ in 250 litre ex-Calvados French apple brandy casks imparting an extra apple and pear character unique to Irish whiskey.

A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at cask strength of 60% ABV.
It was distilled on the 15th December 2005, aged in a PX puncheon number 1930 and bottled on 4th March 2020.
This is bottle number 529.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cragganmore - 15 Year Old 150th Anniversary Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A Cragganmore distillery exclusive bottling to commemorate their 150th anniversary, which was in 2019. It is one of 1869 bottles, which, I don't think is a coincidence matches the year of the distillery's foundation.
This single malt has been double matured in American oak for 15 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teeling - 15 Year Old - The Revival Volume 1 - Rum Barrels
DESCRIPTION:
The Teeling Whisky Co. believe in continuing the evolution of Irish Whiskey by creating new and unique expressions.
This is the first limited-edition bottling in The Teeling Whisky Co. Revival Commemorative Series.  Volume 1, is a 15-Year-Old Single Malt Irish whiskey distilled in 1999 and aged exclusively in rum barrels. To celebrate the introduction of Whiskey distillation to Dublin, the Teeling family have produced a number of commemorative bottlings.  
This is one of 10,000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore  - 12 Year Old  - The Black Isle (1L)
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Dalmore matured equally in American Oak and European Oak, now discontinued but originally only available only at travel retail.
It is named after The Black Isle, which is a peninsula in the Highlands of Scotland, located north of Inverness.
Contrary to its name, the Black Isle is not an island. It is in fact a peninsula, surrounded on three sides by expanses of water, with the Cromarty Firth to the north, the Beauly Firth to the south and the Moray Firth to the east

This 18-year-old is full of authority and is truly a classic, full-bodied dram. With a delicious nose, this whisky will tempt you in and hold your attention as you uncover its unique palate and finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

Distilled at Glenturret on the 30th of March 1978 and bottled for the First Cask series at 21 years of age.  Matured and bottled from cask number #370.
This is bottle number 235.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 8 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 8-year-old Bowmore, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter & wooden box - this is one of just 404 produced.

Distilled on the 24th November 1977 this 22-year-old comes from the Speyside region and more specifically Monnochmore distillery.
This comes from cask #95/23/9. 
This is bottle number 266.

Distilled on the 26th of February 1990, this Ardmore single malt whisky was  selected and bottled by Direct Wines for their First Cask series.
Matured in a single bourbon barrel number #30109 and bottled at 46%.
This is bottle number 173.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ben Nevis  - 18 Year Old Cask - First Cask #1502
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 20th of December 1990, this Ben Nevis single malt whisky was selected and bottled by Direct Wines for their First Cask series.
Matured in a single sherry butt number #1502 for 18 years and bottled at 46%.
The body, structure and character of this Dalmore Cigar Malt is said to be the perfect complement to a fine cigar.

Bottled for the Islay festival - Feis Ile 2014 and encased in this beautiful presentation box.
Double matured in first fill ex-bourbon casks and Amontillado hogsheads.
With the festival becoming more and more popular every year, the older festival bottlings are a great piece of history.
This 40 Year Old Tawny Port is matured in smaller oak barrels, generally 250-350L in volume which develops a lighter colour yet deeper spiced character, than Ruby Ports.

This is the much anticipated 2019 Diageo Special Release of Lagavulin 12-Year-Old.  It features a bird of prey on the label in accordance with the overarching theme of the Diageo Special Release 2019 series  'Rare by Nature'.  Matured in refill American oak casks for 12 years on Islay, it was bottled in 2019 at a natural cask strength of 56.5% abv.

This release was distilled at Glenrothes-Glenlivet Distillery in 1996 and matured in an oak bourbon cask for 21 years before being bottled in 2017 by the independent bottler, Cadenhead's.
This is 1 of only 624 bottles produced.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.
Distilled in 1974, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1987 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.
This 15 year old single malt from Glenmorangie has sadly been discontinued despite being described by top critic Serge Valentin as being "very, very good."

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.
This 18 Year Old Longow is a heavily peated single malt from Springbank.  A very popular dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 16 Year Old - Gallow Hill Single Cask #142608
DESCRIPTION: 'Gallow Hill' is part of a series of single cask releases to celebrate the stunning landscape around Glenlivet. This 16-year-old single malt was named after the hills above the distillery.  Bottled in 2014 from cask #142608.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

This release of Octomore 7.1 is 5 years old and represents everything Octomore style.
This limited edition release once held the record for of the world's most heavily peated single malt whisky @ 208ppm.
Progressive distillers indeed...

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.
A bottling of 12-year-old Strathconon Blended Malt Whisky estimated to have been bottled in the 1970s.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 9 Year Old - Local Barley July 2009
DESCRIPTION: All of the barley used to make this 9 year old has been sourced within the local area of  Kintyre, Scotland (as the name may suggest).  A much sought-after bottle by collectors and investors.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bladnoch - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
In the 1990's Diageo created the Flora and Fauna series. Some bottles are, as usual, harder to come by than others. As it only operated from 1974 until 1993 there is only a very small number of bottlings of their spirit available.
This distillery is the most southerly in Scotland and was founded in the early 1800s. Its Lowland nature produces the most amazing whisky with delicate fruity and lemony aromas. 
Aged 10 years.

Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2008 - Moine French Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of three releases by Bunnahabhain for the 2019 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt was distilled on the February 2008 and was matured for 11 years - it was finished in French Oak before it was bottled at 57.4% ABV in February 2019.  This is a limited edition release of only 1872 bottles produced.
Bunnahabhain is generally regarded as the lighter of the Islay whiskies, although the Moine releases are their heavily peated spirit. This particular example has been finished in French Oak casks.
 
Bottle 1483.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

Suntory is one of the oldest companies in Japanese history.
A fantastic 15 Year Old Blend from Suntory.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - Dràm An Stiùreadair - Feis Ile 2014
DESCRIPTION:
This very limited edition peated Bunnahabhain was released especially for Fèis Ìle 2014.  Matured in Bourbon casks for 9 years, it then spent a final year in a Marsala wine cask.  This is one of just 632 bottles.
This is bottle number 521.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 11 Year Old 2001 - Single Cask 1 - Wee Ruari
DESCRIPTION:
This special 11-year-old Islay single malt was laid down in 2001 as the inaugural distillation of the reborn Bruichladdich distillery.
One of just 376 bottles, this was the first whisky to flow through the stills after the distillery was brought back to life on the 29th May 2001.
 
This is bottle number 185.

Discontinued in 2015, this expression was widely known for being rich and heavily sherried. A shortage was also encountered around the same time which lead to the five years mothballing in 1996 to 2001. 
Very well named due to the relaunch in 2018, where a very subtle difference has to be noted.
The 2018 version combines Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry cask malts. but the original is only from Oloroso Sherry.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Ryder Cup 2014
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ryder Cup Edition which took place in Gleneagles 2014 where Europe thrashed America by 16½ points to 11½, for their third consecutive victory.
Diageo used to own the hotel in Gleneagles and have a bar there dedicated to Johnnie Walker. This hotel has since been taken over.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 23rd November 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 9th of May 2017.  This is one of only 888 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
 
This is bottle number 268.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: kilchoman - 10 Year Old - Kilchoman Club - 5th Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 Year Old Small Batch Release is the 5th edition bottled exclusively for the Kilchoman Club. It was distilled on 6th September and 1st November 2006, matured for 10 years in a bourbon barrel and a sherry butt then bottled in November 2016 as the fifth edition.
This is bottle number 813.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 20 Year Old - The Explorers Series - Brodick Bay - Vol.1
DESCRIPTION:
'Brodick Bay' is Volume 1 in The Aaron Malt 'Explorer Series' which is a collection of limited edition expressions from the Arran Distillery. Each edition celebrates the outstanding scenic beauty and diversity of nature on the Isle of Arran.
This 20 year old single malt has been matured in both Bourbon Barrels and Sherry Hogsheads before being finished in Oloroso Sherry Butts sourced directly from Bodegas Tradicion in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.
The presentation tin and the bottle label features a beautiful view from the foothills south of Brodick Bay.  This is one of 9000 bottles.

An edition of Balvenie's classic single barrel series, a 15-year-old single malt, drawn from a single traditional oak whisky cask and bottled by hand. 50.4%.
 
The label has faded/poor condition - meaning bottling date, in cask date, cask number and bottle number are not available.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1986 before being bottled 15 years later in 2002. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SI.312
Distilled in 1978, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1993 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.

GlenDronach's 15 Year Old Revival was sadly discontinued in 2015 by the distillery due to lack of available stocks.  However, stocks have been replenished and The GlenDronach 15 Year Old Revival has returned. This bottling was matured in Oloroso sherry casks.

GlenDronach's 15 Year Old Revival was sadly discontinued in 2015 by the distillery due to lack of available stocks.  However, stocks have been replenished and The GlenDronach 15 Year Old Revival has returned. This bottling was matured in Oloroso sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

Bottled from cask #2186, this is one of only 424 bottles from the Speyside distillery Craigellachie. Matured for 20 years in oak casks, this dram was distilled back in 1981. 
This is bottle number 219 of 421.
This limited-edition from the ever-popular Springbank distillery was matured for 14 years in ex-bourbon casks from America. Limited to only 9,000 bottles worldwide.

This release of Octomore 7.1 is 5 years old and represents everything Octomore style.
This limited edition release once held the record for of the world's most heavily peated single malt whisky @ 208ppm.
Progressive distillers indeed...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak - Year of the Pig (2 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
With bespoke label designs, this is an eye-catching limited-edition release twin pack containing 2 x 70cl bottles of The Macallan 12-year-old Double Cask single malt whisky.
The bottles and the presentation box feature artwork celebrating Chinese New Year 2019 (the year of the Pig).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak - Year of the Dog (1 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
With bespoke label designs, this is an eye-catching limited-edition release twin pack containing 1 x 70cl bottles of The Macallan 12-year-old Double Cask single malt whisky.
The bottles and the presentation box feature artwork celebrating Chinese New Year 2018 (the year of the Dog), the eleventh in the 12-year cycle of the zodiac.
The beautiful illustration is also inspired by the incredible story behind The Macallan’s exceptional oak casks and the extraordinary journey that takes the oak from the forest floor to the distillery in Scotland
There is only 1 x 70cl in this duo pack included in this lot.

Matured in sherry wood for 26 years comes this 5cl miniature of Macallan.
Regularly setting records at auctions, The Macallan minis are one of the most sought after in the world.

Distilled on the 1st of August 1991 comes this rare Mortlach Speyside single malt whisky. A product selected and bottled from Direct Wines under the brand First Cask.
Matured in a single sherry butt number 7713 and bottled at 46%.
This is bottle number 594.

Only 675 bottles have been produced from cask #802 is Speysides Benriach distillery. The dram was overseen by Billy Walker, a master distiller who we all know is a very talented man.
Distilled in 1988 it was eventually bottled in 2005.

Matured in sherry wood for 26 years comes this 5cl miniature of Macallan.
Regularly setting records at auctions, The Macallan minis are one of the most sought after in the world.
This special release commemorates 175 years of Talisker Distillery. It was a limited release of 60,000 bottles, bottled in 2005.

Distilled in 1994 it was eventually bottled in 2013. 
Bottle 157 of 344.
Distilled in 2006, this 13-Year-old botted in 2019 at the natural cask strength of 55.5%.  This is one of only 267 bottles produced.

It has been matured in Oloroso casks and because of its closure in 1996 some of these 18-year-old expressions released after 2015 will be much older than stated.

Old Pulteney 17 Year Old got a very high score in the whisky bible - 96.5! All this in the same year as receiving an award for the best whisky in the world.
This specific bottling has since been discontinued... you know what that means.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.

Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
This is bottle number 29.
The first release of Kilkerran 'Work in Progress', a single malt from Springbank's Glengyle distillery. Matured in oak, released in 2009, this is one of 9000 bottles released worldwide.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

This Glenlivet 16 Year Old single ex-bourbon refill hogshead was bottled by SMWS at 57.3%. This is one of 277 bottles.  Named a puff of candy on a tropical island. 
SMWS was founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

5 years old and a travel retail exclusive, this single malt was matured in American Oak bourbon casks and peated to 208 ppm.
The malt was finished in Syrah wine casks from France's Rhone Valley.

DESCRIPTION: A Kilkerran bottled to celebrate the open day in 2019 and has been released at 57.1% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Port & Wine Casks Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Ahead of the rest in many ways, this distillery has been planning for the future since the 1920's when it was bottling its single malt. Along that southern coast of Islay are the 3 big hitters, Ardbeg, Lagavulin and of course Laphroaig. What many fail to realise is that Laphroaig is one of the largest if not the largest producer of whisky on the island. They also were one of the first-ever distilleries to hire a female distillery manager.
Friendship" in Gaelic is Cairdeas and this is the 2020 Feis Ile release. It has been matured in a both second fill ruby port casks and ex-bourbon casks before eventually being transferred into in ex-red wine barrels for the finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Signed Edition & Scroll
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park 18 Year Old has been named Best Spirit in the World in the Spirit Journal, on two separate occasions. A highly acclaimed and a favourite single malt of many.

The 28th release from Dramfool is a rare cask of Lochindaal.
Lochindaal was distilled at Bruichladdich Distillery using barley peated to 50ppm phenols.  Only 250 casks were ever filled with Lochindaal spirit making it very rare.
The whisky was matured in a bourbon barrel (probably first fill going on the colour) and bottled un-chill-filtered at the cask strength of 63.0%.  This is one of 234 bottles.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition. The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Suntory - 12 Year Old Year of the Monkey 2004 60cl 43%
DESCRIPTION: Suntory is one of the oldest companies in Japanese history. This bottling was released in 2002 as a 12 year old blend to celebrate the Year of the Monkey 2004.
