DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional and presented in a case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.
This Italian wine is of a great vintage, 1990 from Vendemmia.

The 24th release from Dramfool is 10-Year-Old Lochindaal.
Lochindaal was distilled at Bruichladdich Distillery using barley peated to 50ppm phenols.  Only 250 casks were ever filled with Lochindaal spirit making it very rare.
The whisky was matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel and bottled un-chill-filtered at the cask strength of 63.2%, this is one of 221 bottles.

DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2014 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon barrels and Amontillado seasoned traditional hogsheads.  It was bottled at 51.4% ABV.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Old Style
DESCRIPTION:
An older, and now very rare, bottling of Johnie Walker Blue Label. 
With its distinctive square bottle, the label angled precisely at 24° and the iconic Striding Man, Johnnie Walker is the world's best selling Scotch whisky. It was created in Kilmarnock in 1865 and is now available in almost every country in the world. Between 1906 & 1909 John Walker's grandsons introduced the colour names which the bottles still bear to this day.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 23 Year Old - 1990 First Cask #2759
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on 9th April 1990 and bottled 23 years later by Signatory Vintage for Direct Wines, part of their extensive First Cask series. 
Matured in single hogshead #2759 and bottled at 46%.
This is bottle number 52.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Elgin - 20 Year Old - 1990 First Cask #7871
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 29th of November 1990, comes this rare Glen Elgin Speyside single malt whisky. A product selected and bottled from Direct Wines under the brand First Cask.
Matured in a single bourbon barrel number #7871 and bottled at 46%.
This is bottle number 10.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 20 Year Old - 1990 First Cask #2757
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on 9th April 1990 and bottled 20 years later by Signatory Vintage for Direct Wines, part of their extensive First Cask series. 
Matured in single hogshead #2757 and bottled at 46%.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

This bottle is one of no more than 800 bottles drawn from the single cask number 11168. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
Bottle 534.

Inspired by the long-gone tradition of daily tea break whisky ration, the cask strength Teapot Dram Batch No. 007 is deliberately young and bold. A strictly limited release of just ten first fill European Oak Oloroso Sherry casks, the Teapot Dram Batch No. 007 was bottled at cask strength and was exclusively available from the Glengoyne Distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Suntory - Special Reserve Paired Bird Tsukuba Expo 1985
DESCRIPTION:
Presented on a white oak platform, this Suntory Bird Set was released commemorate the Tsukuba Expo in 1985.
Every year at the expo, Suntory has a theme and this particular year was 'Today Birds, Tomorrow Me'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2007 French Brandy Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Most of the whisky coming from the distillery prior to 2012 was lightly peated. However, in 2012 a change was to come...
Approximately 20% of production contains 35-45ppm peat.
A limited release from warehouse number 8 and distilled in 2007. This beauty is finished in a French Brandy Cask. Bottled in 2019.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

Part of the Dalmore Rivers Collection, the Spey Dram season 2011.
A classic Salmon fishing river, the Spey runs in the heart of Scotland’s malt whisky region.
The iconic status of the River Spey and those who travel from around the world to fish it, Dalmore created this exclusive expression.

While whisky from the Caol Ila is usually smoky, but this yearly release looks at the distillery's other, less well-known side: unpeated spirit. The 2018 bottling was matured in refill and rejuvenated American-oak hogsheads and ex-bodega European oak butts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 2007 Valinch 11 Year Old - CSC:01
DESCRIPTION:
From Bruichladdich, this Port Charlotte Valinch single cask is an 11 year-old distilled in Islay in 2007, matured in 2nd fill cabernet sauvignon #2053.  This is a distillery exclusive release of 433 bottles at 59.5% ABV.  This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 391.

Bottle 13198.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow Red - 11 Year Old - Pinot Noir
DESCRIPTION:
In early 2018, Springbank added another release to their incredibly popular Longrow Red series.  This Longrow Red release is 11 years old and heavily peated.  It was bottled at 53.1%, and spent 8 years in bourbon casks before completing its maturation with 3 years in Refill Pinot Noir Barriques. 
Springbank Longrow Red, is always bottled at cask strength, is released annually in small quantities and every year a different type of red wine cask is used to mature the whisky.  
This is a limited edition of only 9,000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range 1930s Propeller Plane
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle labels and outer boxes, with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
This lot is the 1930's propeller plane design which features both on the bottle lable and on the outer box.

DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition is part of Macallans award-winning 1824 Collection.  It is a delicious single malt layered with fruit and spice crafted by Bob Dalgarno. Released exclusively for Travel Retail only.
This is one of a limited edition of 6 x-ray bones photographed by Nick Veasey, for Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition. This particular bottling celebrates No.4 on their list of the 6 pillars - The exceptional Oak casks.

DESCRIPTION: Matured for eight years in a Bourbon cask, then transferred to casks that previously held claret from St Julien, Bordeaux.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Henry McKenna - 2008 Single Barrel Bourbon 10 Year Old #4459
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled at Heaven Hill Bernheim on 22nd August 2007 this single barrel bourbon was matured and bottled 10 years later. 
This is not Henry McKenna first time around the block, it was part of the Seagram portfolio for a large part of the 20th century and was previously distilled at Fairfield. 
Great bourbon and becoming ever harder to get your hands on!

DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Amsterdam Airport.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #1765 at a cask strength of 63.4% ABV.  With only 471 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Orcadian - 14 Year Old Blackadder 1989
DESCRIPTION:
Robin Tucek founded Blackadder in 1995 and was famous for being the co-author of the whisky book The Malt Whisky File: The Essential Guide for the Malt Whisky Connoisseur.
Robin chooses every bottle but it is a family-run business.
An Orcadian malt whisky aged for 14 years from cask: 2003/HO09. Bottled at 43%.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 15 Year Old - (1993) Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This Douglas Laing Old Malt cask Scapa was distilled in September 1993. It was matured in single cask DL REF 4713. Before being bottled at 15 years of age in October 2008. This is one of just 334 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 11 Year Old - Grog Myrtle - SMWS 53.321
DESCRIPTION: This 11 year old single cask Caol Ila was released by SMWS in celebration of the 2020 Islay Festival.  This is one of just 265 bottles produced from the single Refill Bourbon Hogshead

This bottle is one of no more than 800 bottles drawn from the single cask number 11168. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
Bottle number 535.

From the eastern highlands, this award-winning malt was pretty much removed from everyone's thoughts, that was until it was bought over by Bacardi. Aberfeldy has a highly rated visitor centre which opened at the turn of the millennium and attracts over thirty thousand visitors a year.
Brought to market in 2005, this 21-year-old is one of Aberfeldy flagship bottles. 
The World Whisky Awards, in 2007 awarded this the Best Mainland Single Malt.
This is bottle number B26767.

The Glendronach 18 Year Old Allardice continues to follow its ethos with this heavily sherried Whisky.
It has been matured in Oloroso casks and because of its closure in 1996 some of these 18-year-old expressions released after 2015 will be much older than stated.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 21 Year Old - Gran Reserva Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich Gran Reserva has matured and mellowed in American Oak Casks for 21 years before been finished in previously used Caribbean Rum casks for 4 months.
This unique Glenfiddich bottle is infused with a spicy warmth and indulgent toffee sweetness, with hints of tobacco.

Yula 20 Years Old is the first in a trilogy of Limited Edition blended Island Malt Scotch Whiskies in this Douglas Laing series. Bottled at the cask strength of 52.6% ABV and a limited release of only 900 bottles worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - Cask Strength 2017- Distillery Only
DESCRIPTION:
This cask strength Caol Ila, was released only at the distillery shop in 2017.
3000 bottles were made available and bottled the natural cask strength of 58.8%.

Kininvie 1996 17 Year Old Batch #001 35cl
Owned by William Grant & Sons this malt is somewhat mysterious. 
A travel retail exclusive which was matured in both European Sherry and American Oak Casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 21 Year Old - Gran Reserva Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich Gran Reserva has matured and mellowed in American Oak Casks for 21 years before been finished in previously used Caribbean Rum casks for 4 months.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 24 Year Old Highland Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
A mysterious whisky aged for 24 years and released for Aldi. 
Very well priced originally made it very attractive and has been in demand ever since.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was distilled in 2002 and then poured into first-fill ex-bourbon barrels to age until it was bottled in 2017. It was bottled at 43% ABV.

After opening in 2005, this release is from 2019 and is made from the following four casks that were bottled at cask strength on the 27th November 2019
Distilled 11th October 2006: Bourbon cask #283/2006 Distilled 1st November 2007: Bourbon cask #376/2007 Distilled 30th May 2007: Bourbon cask #137/2007 Distilled 13th December 2007: Sherry cask #425/2007 
One of 1242 bottles.
