This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

This is a limited-edition bottle of Royal Lochnagar Selected Reserve, matured in refill sherry butts and casks, and bottled in 2018.
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2032.

This is the much anticipated 2019 Diageo Special Release of Lagavulin 12-Year-Old.  It features a bird of prey on the label in accordance with the overarching theme of the Diageo Special Release 2019 series  'Rare by Nature'.  Matured in refill American oak casks for 12 years on Islay, it was bottled in 2019 at a natural cask strength of 56.5% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton of Glen Ord - 18 Year Old - 2019 Special Release
DESCRIPTION: Glen Ord bottled as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2019 - part of the 'Rare by Nature' theme.  Matured in American oak hogsheads, this 18-year-old expression boasts plenty of fruit and spice aplenty.  The label features a fish swimming around berries and foliage.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bladnoch - 12 Year Old Red Wine Single Cask 2020/01 #38
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2020 this single cask has been matured in a red wine hogshead. Only 289 bottles were released from the Lowland distillery.
This is bottle number 264.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

This is a limited-edition bottle of Royal Lochnagar Selected Reserve, matured in refill sherry butts and casks, and bottled in 2018.
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2016.

The is the series of Pillaged Malts and it has been said that this will never be repeated!
The 3 Isles Classic Pillage is a vatting of bottles from Jura, Ardbeg and Tobermory
This challenge was completed on 8/9/10.
Bottle 191 /200

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow Red - 11 Year Old - Pinot Noir
DESCRIPTION:
In early 2018, Springbank added another release to their incredibly popular Longrow Red series.  This Longrow Red release is 11 years old and heavily peated.  It was bottled at 53.1%, and spent 8 years in bourbon casks before completing its maturation with 3 years in Refill Pinot Noir Barriques. 
Springbank Longrow Red, is always bottled at cask strength, is released annually in small quantities and every year a different type of red wine cask is used to mature the whisky.  
This is a limited edition of only 9,000 bottles.
This lot contains 2 x 5cl bottles.

This 13-year-old Longrow Red released in 2017, is a limited edition from the Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. It was matured for 12 years in bourbon casks then finished in Malbec casks for 15 months and bottled at 51.3%.

From Càrn Mòrs strictly limited range, this bottling is presented in their new style of packaging. 
Bottled by Morrison and Mackay whisky merchants. Only 605 bottled were produced from 2 casks. 
They were distilled in 1997 and bottled in 2002.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2118 - Edinburgh Airport and World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Edinburgh Airport and World Duty Free.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in ex-sherry refill butt #2118 at a cask strength of 59.9% ABV.  With only 300 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2634 - Arlanda Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Arlanda Airport.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2634 at the cask strength of 62.4% ABV.  With only 275 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - 2005 Single Cask Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland Cask #2390
DESCRIPTION: A 14 year old single cask Highland Park bottled for the Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland in 2019.  It was from cask no. 2390 which was a 1st fill American Sherry Oak puncheon.  This is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and is one of 657 Bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2966 - Bulgaria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Bulgaria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2966 at the cask strength of 63% ABV.  With only 318 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6577 - Belgium
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Belgium.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6577 at the cask strength of 64.1% ABV.  With only 594 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Fino Sherry - Distillery Exclusive - Small Batch #2
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition Arran is from the 'small-batch edition' and is a distillery exclusive release, limited to 597 bottles.  Part of batch 2 in 2016, bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.4%.
The malt has been exclusively matured in a fino sherry cask aged in the Arran Lochranza Warehouse.
A rare bottle of new spirit from Kilchoman. Because it was bottled at 2 years old it cannot be called whisky.  Bottled in 2009, this was an example of what to expect from the new distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.
This is a 5cl bottling.

While whisky from the Caol Ila is usually smoky, but this yearly release looks at the distillery's other, less well-known side: unpeated spirit. The 2018 bottling was matured in refill and rejuvenated American-oak hogsheads and ex-bodega European oak butts.

Aged in a Grand Cru classe cask, #1 this is for the exclusive club of Jura fans. It is the 2012 release for the Diurachs.
This is bottle number 22.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton of Glen Ord - 18 Year Old - 2019 Special Release
DESCRIPTION: Glen Ord bottled as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2019 - part of the 'Rare by Nature' theme.  Matured in American oak hogsheads, this 18-year-old expression boasts plenty of fruit and spice aplenty.  The label features a fish swimming around berries and foliage.
Rumoured to be distilled at Bushmills, this Irish single malt whisky incredibly was aged for 26 years and bottled exclusively for supermarket chain Aldi.

This is the much anticipated 2019 Diageo Special Release of Lagavulin 12-Year-Old.  It features a bird of prey on the label in accordance with the overarching theme of the Diageo Special Release 2019 series  'Rare by Nature'.  Matured in refill American oak casks for 12 years on Islay, it was bottled in 2019 at a natural cask strength of 56.5% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2634 - Arlanda Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Arlanda Airport.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2634 at the cask strength of 62.4% ABV.  With only 275 bottles available, this is a limited edition.
This 40 Year Old Tawny Port was bottled in 2019.

This is the much anticipated 2019 Diageo Special Release of Lagavulin 12-Year-Old.  It features a bird of prey on the label in accordance with the overarching theme of the Diageo Special Release 2019 series  'Rare by Nature'.  Matured in refill American oak casks for 12 years on Islay, it was bottled in 2019 at a natural cask strength of 56.5% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 18 Year Old - Royal Troon 18th Green
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was released as part of the Bruichladdich Links collection. This 18-year-old single malt depicts Royal Troon, the 18th Green.
The Bruichladdich Links collection was created in a partnership with Graeme Baxter, a famous world-leading Golf Course artist. It is a series of releases, each features a different golf course.

Old Pulteney 17 Year Old got a very high score in the whisky bible - 96.5! All this in the same year as receiving an award for the best whisky in the world.
This specific bottling has since been discontinued... you know what that means.
One of 192 bottles, this Auchentoshan was distilled in 1992, matured Bourbon Barrel 23 years and was bottled in February 2016 by Cadenhead at the natural cask strength.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

This bottle is an independent bottling from Specialty Drinks, it is a 19 year old malt from Port Askaig in Islay. 
There is no distillery called Port Askaig so it has been named after an ancient ferry port and fishing harbour from the east coast of the island.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask #6204 - Runa (25th Anniversary)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for the 25th Anniversary of Runa. Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6204 and bottled aat the cask strength of 62% ABV.  With only 618 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchentoshan - 18 Year Old Limited Edition Oloroso Sherry
DESCRIPTION: From the Lowlands of Scotland comes this 18 year old limited edition. It has been matured in Oloroso Sherry casks for 18 years.

'Organic' was released as part of Bruichladdich's Futures collection.  The single malt was distilled in on 15/08/2005 using Publican barley and aged in bourbon casks for until April 2011. This is an individually numbered bottle.
Bottle number 783.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenalba - 34 Year Old - Sherry Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Sold by the supermarket chain Lidl, this blended whisky was bottled by the Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Company.
This blend is a minimum of 34 years old and has a sherry cask finish.
Batch JM/012 Lot No 0862B.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Penderyn - Single Cask Ratafia Champenois Finish T-016
DESCRIPTION:
From the Welsh distillery, Penderyn is in central Wales.
It is one of the smallest distilleries in the world.
This specific bottling was for Dumangin J Fils. It was bottled in January 2020 after a finishing period of 18 months in Ratafia Champenois Casks.
Batch #4.
Bottle number 373.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich is a pre-closure edition from Whyte & Mackay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North British - 30 Year Old 30th Release Dramfool
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1989 and bottled 2020 this grain whisky was matured in a bourbon barrel for 30 years.
Bottled by the highly acclaimed Dramfool. Bruce has been widely recognised as one of the best Indy bottlers around.
This is their 30th release.

A single cask, single grain bottling from Cambus by James Eadie. Matured in cask #48094 for 26 years, this is one of just 617 bottles filled at the natural cask strength of 55.4%.
This is bottle 409.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old - Sherry Wood - Open Day 2016
DESCRIPTION:
A special Campbeltown single malt aged for 8 years in Sherry wood.
It was bottled at the cask strength of 56.4% for the distillery's Open Day in 2016.
This Glenglassaugh 1983 was specially selected and bottled in 1997 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilchoman - Distillery Shop Exclusive 2010 - Single Cask #278
DESCRIPTION:
This 9 Year Old is one of only 637 bottles released exclusively at the Kilchoman Distillery Shop.
Bottled on the 28th May 2019 and distilled 28th May 2010 this single cask was fully matured in a Bourbon cask #278/2010.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Grant - 18 Year Old  - Rare Edition
DESCRIPTION: This bottling of 18-year-old Glen Grant was released in 2016 and has since been Jim Murray's Scotch Whisky of the Year for 2017, 2019 and 2020.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

This is one of 10,000 bottles that consist of a vatting of thirty 2011 bourbon barrels. 
They were merged or married for three months in Sauternes casks and then bottled in 2016

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchentoshan - 18 Year Old  Limited Edition Oloroso Sherry
DESCRIPTION: From the Lowlands of Scotland comes this 18 year old limited edition. It has been matured in Oloroso Sherry casks for 18 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Viking Pride - Travel Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Viking Pride by Highland Park is an 18 year old single malt.
This bottle has been bottled at its marrying strength of 46%.
For Viking Pride, Highland Parks Master Whisky Maker Gordon Motion carefully selects up to 120 casks which have matured for 18 years or longer and marries them together, the flavours slowly combine and gather depth and consistency.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak  - Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition Macallan 12 year old was exclusively matured in sherry seasoned oak casks, from Jerez.  It comes in a metal presentation tin featuring an image of a barrel shot by Magnum photographer Alex Soth.

Very popular across the pond in the USA an unknown to many blend, Cluny.
Rumoured to have a high malt content.
A rare and discontinued 1990s Glenmorangie Port Wood Finish.  Aged for at least 12 years in American oak casks before being finished in Port pipes.

This is the 2018 release of 1770 Glasgow single malt from the Glasgow distillery, which brought whisky production back to the city for the first time in over 100 years. 
This is release No1. 
This is a 50cl bottling.

A bottle of Harrod's Balnagown single malt Scotch whisky - a non gestatement Balblair single malt. This bottling is named after the Balnagown Estate in the Highlands of Scotland, which has been owned by Mohammad Al-Fayed (former Chairman of Harrods) since the early 1970s.

The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky matured in a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks. Released for the travel retail market.

Pronounced Kill-Hard, this blended malt not only tastes fantastic but has the story to match. It came about when Alex Bruce, from Ardnamurchan and Anthony Wills both came to the realisation their surnames combined to make the famous film star...Bruce Wills. 
Only 686 bottles were produced of this blended dram and approximately 200 were available in February 2020 in Newzealand for Dramfest.

Owned by Signatory since 2002 this Edradour is a bottling for La Maison Du Whisky. Previous owners include Pernod Richard. 
This Highland malt used to own the title of the smallest whisky distillery in the world.
This specific bottling is label #9 and was matured for 10 years in a first, fill sherry cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #4250
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a Refill Hogshead and bottled in 2017.
Distilled in 2005 this released was limited to 624 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North British - 30 Year Old 30th Release Dramfool
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1989 and bottled 2020 this grain whisky was matured in a bourbon barrel for 30 years.
Bottled by the highly acclaimed Dramfool. Bruce has been widely recognised as one of the best Indy bottlers around.
This is their 30th release.

Auchentoshan's release of the 'Three Wood' was hugely popular and this is where it all began. This is the original bottling which has been matured in a combination of American bourbon, Spanish Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Emerald Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Emerald-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky from the Chivas Royal Salute Range.
This is a 1L bottling of the popular dram Glenlivet 12-Year-Old.  It has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold Double Cask (Limited Edition with 2 x Glasses)
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition that comes with 2 branded glasses.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

A rare old vintage bottling of the Singleton (when it was still from Auchroisk).
This is a 75cl bottle.

A fully organic Bruichladdich 2003 - a century ago most barley was organically grown; natural fertilisers – seaweed, peat and manure – were harnessed in a way that respected the year’s agricultural cycle. 2003 was a particularly fine harvest of Chalice barley for William rose at Culblair Farm. Supreme quality barley combined with a slow trickle-distillation to do it justice, and new oak has resulted in Bruichladdichs creamiest release yet.  This is a limited edition release of 15,000 numbered bottles and Bruichladdichs first organic release - The name means 'In the Traditional Way.' 
Bottle number 2745.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.
a 1999 vintage Dalmore bottled by Gordon & MacPhail's and presented as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. It was left to age until 2014, when it was bottled at 46% ABV.

Kilchoman's Am Bùrach - meaning "the mess" in Gaelic! Created when a Stillman mixed together some Machir Bay and Port Matured Kilchoman while vatting casks! The whisky was filled back into Bourbon barrels and eventually given a finishing period in ruby port casks creating an unintentionally tasty dram!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old - Recharred Sherry - Open Day 2018
DESCRIPTION:
A special Campbeltown single malt aged for 8 years in re-charred sherry casks.
It was bottled at the cask strength of @ 58.4% for the distillery's Open Day in 2018.
This is a highly acclaimed mystery single malt, that has been aged for 29 years in oak casks.  This is a limited edition release of 11,000 bottles, produced for the supermarket chain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 13 Year Old 2005 Queen of the Hebridies 2nd Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Filled on the 1st of June 2005 in a Sherry Hogshead, this Bruichladdich was matured on Islay for 13 years. It was bottled on April 1st 2019. Only 184 bottles were produced from this American Oak cask #385 in 2019. 
This is the second edition in a 3 part series that hold L BAnks, D Wood and S Birchs signature on the label. These gentlemen were huge whisky enthusiast and loved their pilgrimage to the Inner Hebrides. 
While this cask was maturing nicely, Mr Wood could almost smell it as he was distillery manager at Caol Ila distillery. 
Bottle number 67.

A blended Scotch whisky from the Springbank distillery's owners, J& A Mitchell. A blend of 45 different whiskies from all around Scotland.
The significance of the number 45 is that it is the percentage of voters saying 'Yes' in the 2014 Scottish Independence Referendum

Kilchoman Distillery has sponsored the Islay Pipe Band since 2012 and this sponsorship has taken the form of a cask of whisky selected by John MacLellan, bottled and sold from the distillery with all the proceeds going to the Pipe Band.
The 2014 Islay Pipe Band single cask was a single octave and was a limited release of just 126 individually numbered bottles.
This single cask bottling has been matured bourbon cask #785/2010. Distilled in 2010, finished in a px cask and was bottled in 2016 by Kilchoman Distillery exclusively for the Distillery Shop.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: WhistlePig - 10 Year Old - Single Barrel (Barrel 2434) - Nickolls & Perks
DESCRIPTION: This WhistlePig 10-Year-Old straight rye whiskey, hand-selected and bottled exclusively for Nickolls & Perks. Presented at a natural cask strength of 61.2% ABV (122.3 proof).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton of Glen Ord - Distillery Exclusive - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 2019, distillery exclusive limited-edition bottling. This is one of 6000 bottles produced.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle released by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex-bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.3
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the third release in the series.

A private bottling from Kilchoman, one of Islays younger distilleries. Distilled in 31/5/06 and has been matured in a bourbon cask ##2006/81.
Bottled in 2016 at 61.7%

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - Six Kingdoms
DESCRIPTION: The final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection! The Six Kingdoms - a limited edition, 15-Year-Old Mortlach.  Matured in first-fill sherry casks and finished in American oak bourbon casks. It comes in a  presented in a metallic gold presentation tube, decorated with a pen and ink drawing of the mysterious three-eyed raven (aka Bran the Broken).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - Six Kingdoms
DESCRIPTION: The final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection! The Six Kingdoms - a limited edition, 15-Year-Old Mortlach.  Matured in first-fill sherry casks and finished in American oak bourbon casks. It comes in a  presented in a metallic gold presentation tube, decorated with a pen and ink drawing of the mysterious three-eyed raven (aka Bran the Broken).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Sapphire Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Sapphire-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky from the Chivas Royal Salute Range.

10,000 bottles were produced of this Kilchoman Autumn 2009 release which was only the second release from the distillery.
3 years in bourbon casks and finished in Oloroso sherry casks. Just to top it off a 3 year old refill bourbon barrel was added to the vatting.

This is a limited-edition bottle of Royal Lochnagar Selected Reserve, matured in refill sherry butts and casks, and bottled in 2007.
This is one of only 4710, individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 1944.

This Benromach Peat Smoke was distilled in 2010 and was bottled in 2018. Benromach's Peat Smoke expressions have long been rather popular, and this a well-loved variation - Peat Smoke Sherry Cask Matured. Matured in a first-fill sherry hogshead and bottled at the cask strength of 59.9%, this is one of 6,500 bottles produced.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.
The distillery has recently been bought by Mark Reynier and this is a release prior to this in the older style packaging.

This sherried 2006 vintage Glen Elgin was filled into single refill sherry cask #802271 and was bottled by Adelphi at 14 years old.  This is one of just 290 bottles, at the cask strength of 52.7% ABV.
Glen Elgin is situated on the outskirts of the Royal Burgh of Elgin on the banks of the River Lossie.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 as part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

This lowland distillery released this limited edition after being matured for 16 years in bourbon barrels. 
It has been triple distilled at Auchentoshan.

A 12 Year Old Miltonduff, aged in single refill American oak sherry hogshead #800734 and bottled by Adelphi for their Selection range at the natural cask strength of 59.5%. One of only 189 bottles charged.
A special ceramic decanter from Glenfiddich, part of a series to recognise famous Scots. This edition carries a picture of Robert the Bruce.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - 15 Year Old (2002) - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This Auchrosik was distilled in October 2002 and bottled 17 years later in January 2018 at 50%, by Hunter Laing for The Old Malt Cask range. This is one of only 341 bottles charged from refill hogshead #14652.

This 8-year-old is estimated to be a 1980s bottling.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.
This is a Empresa Das Aguas import.

This Japanese whisky from Nikka is a 12 year old. With a majority of malt whisky from Nikkas 2 distilleries in northern Japan - Yoichi and and Miyagikyo - and a grain whisky distilled in a Coffey still, all the elements at the heart of Nikka are brought together in one exceptional whisky.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

Suntory has been around creating Japanese whisky from the very beginning and was established in 1899 by Shinjirō Torii. His first venture was a wine shop in Osaka, Japan. 
This is an older bottling of their blended whiskies from some of the oldest distilleries in Japan. 
Bottled Pre - 1989.
This bottling has been matured bourbon cask #328/2007. Distilled in 2007, it was bottled in 2012 by Kilchoman Distillery exclusively for the Distillery Shop.

A travel exclusive release by Bruichladdich's Port Charlotte. MC:01 was initially matured in American whiskey and French oak casks, before being combined and finished in casks that previously held Sicilian wine.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Big Peat - 8 Year Old - Feis Ile 2020 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A small batch of this 8-year-old "Big Peat" was made just for the Islay festival - Feis Ile 2020. 
This bottle is just one of only 3000 bottles by Douglas Laing

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Big Peat - 8 Year Old - Feis Ile 2020 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A small batch of this 8-year-old "Big Peat" was made just for the Islay festival - Feis Ile 2020. 
This bottle is just one of only 3000 bottles by Douglas Laing

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

This bottling of 2002 vintage Tormore was bottled for the Gordon & MacPhail's Private Collection Wood Finish Range in March 2017.  The single malt was finished in Cote Rotie Wood and this is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruicladdich - 9 Year Old - Valinch 43 - Craig Woodrow
DESCRIPTION:
Edition 43 in the Bruichladdich Valinch collection, that features the employees of Bruichladdich. This release features Craig Woodrow- Assistant Bottling Hall Manager.
Distilled in July 2009 and aged for 9 years in a Premium Itallian Wine Cask #2281.
This is one of only 421 bottles produced. 
This is bottle number 183.

This limited-edition was exclusively available to purchase at Blair Athol distillery, released in 2019. Matured in refill rejuvenated and American Oak ex-bourbon casks, this is one of just 6000 bottles available.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Triple Cask Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 12 Year Old was Triple Cask matured in a mixture of European and American oak casks that have previously contained Sherry, as well as American oak casks which have contained Bourbon.  It comes presented in a limited edition tin.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton of Glen Ord - Distillery Exclusive - Batch 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 2019, distillery exclusive limited-edition bottling. This is one of 6000 bottles produced.
This is a highly acclaimed mystery single malt, that has been aged for 29 years in oak casks.  This is a limited edition release of 11,000 bottles, produced for the supermarket chain.
This 40 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in a handcrafted wooden box almost like iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.
This 12 Year Old Springbank was produced from 100% organic barley then matured in American Bourbon casks.

Aged for 16 years and matured in three different types of cask; Oloroso, bourbon & port wine for a combination of rich fruitiness & malty nuttiness and creating what is sure to become a classic Irish malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - Six Kingdoms
DESCRIPTION: The final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection! The Six Kingdoms - a limited edition, 15-Year-Old Mortlach.  Matured in first-fill sherry casks and finished in American oak bourbon casks. It comes in a  presented in a metallic gold presentation tube, decorated with a pen and ink drawing of the mysterious three-eyed raven (aka Bran the Broken).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 14 Year Old - Peated Triple Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in three most traditional casks types, this malt was aged for 14 years. This non-chill filtered, bottled at 48.3% ABV and launched exclusively to travel retail in June 2017.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

The second edition of 'Work in Progress' Kilkerran single malt from Springbank's Glengyle distillery. Released in 2010, it is lightly peated and double distilled. This is one of 15,000 bottles produced.

From the Speyside distillery, Spey, this single malt has been finished in Tawny Port casks. 
Bottled at 46% ABV.

A limited edition from Wolfburn Distillery to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the end of The First World War.  A total of 1918 bottles were produced and sold exclusively from the distillery and through the Carnegie Whisky Cellars in Dornoch.  This project is important to both companies and was proposed to Wolfburn Distillery due to the owners of Wolfburn being former British Servicemen and the importance of the Poppy Appeal to all service personnel and their families.
It's a lightly peated single malt, featuring a small portion of the whisky drawn from sherry casks, and has been bottled at 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Orcadian - 10 Year Old Blackadder Cask Strength 55.8%
DESCRIPTION:
Robin Tucek founded Blackadder in 1995 and was famous for being the co-author of the whisky book The Malt Whisky File: The Essential Guide for the Malt Whisky Connoisseur.
Robin chooses every bottle but it is a family-run business.
An Orcadian malt whisky aged for 10 years from cask: 2003/HO8. Bottled at 55.8%.

Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

'Organic' was released as part of Bruichladdich's Futures collection.  The single malt was distilled in December 2004 using Publican / Oxbridge Optic barley and aged in bourbon casks for until April 2011. This is an individually numbered bottle.
Bottle number 1173.
Some may not recognise this Glenallchie single malt in its older style packaging. It was distilled in 1970s and matured for 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold Double Cask (Limited Edition Tin)
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.
This is a limited edition that comes in a tin presentation box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 10 Year old 2008 Artist Collective LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was designed by artist Serge Le Fox and was distilled back in 2008. It was matured for 10 years in 9 refill bourbon barrels.
Clynelish has seen a resurgence in the last few years with the announcement of the reopening of Brora distillery on the horizon.
Comes with 2 branded glasses.

This Japanese whisky from Nikka is a 12 year old. With a majority of malt whisky from Nikkas 2 distilleries in northern Japan - Yoichi and and Miyagikyo - and a grain whisky distilled in a Coffey still, all the elements at the heart of Nikka are brought together in one exceptional whisky.

One of the largest independent whisky producers, this distillery from Speyside is still well and truly in the family. Run since 1860 from the Grants family, the name of the distillery means the valley of the green grass. 
This unique set with two glasses comes with their great 15 year old expression.

This limited release is from Batch No.06.  This 1-year-old Ardnamurchin spirit was released by independent bottler Adelphi.  It was matured in px and oloroso sherry octaves.  Bottled on 12th August 2018, this is one of only 157 bottles.

A bottle of Longrow CV which used to be Longrow's entry-level whisky. Longrow is Springbank's heavily peated whisky - this is a no age statement expression.  It was named Best Peated Malt at the 2010 Malt Maniacs Awards.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 18 Year Old That Boutique-y Whisky Company Batch 13
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 377 bottles this is Batch 13 from the Islay distillery Caol Ila. Matured for 18 years this dram has been bottled at cask strength - 50.5%.
Their labels are always fantastic and here the distillery looks out to Jura, and it seems like they'll be having some visitors shortly... A stampede of deer and Prince Vultan from that one '80s movie!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenalba - 25 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Sold by the supermarket chain Lidl, this blended whisky was bottled by the Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Company.
This blend is a minimum of 25 years old and has a sherry cask finish.
Batch SE/425 Lot No 0274J

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 12 Year Old 2005 Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2005 from the Speyside distillery, Mortlach. This expression was aged for 12 years in a refill Hogshead HL:13298.
It was bottled in Feb 2017 and only 315 bottles were produced. This dram is said to have a sweet nose with hints of apple sauce and baked shortbread.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Braeval - 15 Year Old 2001 Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: From the Old Malt Cask Range produced by Hunter Laing, this Speyside single malt has been aged for 15 years. It comes from as one of only 677 bottles from a Sherry Butt.

Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

Lumina is part of The Macallan Quest range which was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It features four no-age statement expressions showing off the many, many miles travelled to sources the casks to mature the Speyside whisky. The Lumina expression is made with whisky aged in sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks, as well as hogsheads. While sherry does get a good look-in with this one, it's a much more vanilla and toffee-focussed dram.
This is a 12-year-old single malt from Benromach Distillery in Speyside. It was handcrafted by just 2 men, at what was Speyside's smallest distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 11 Year Old - 2008 Professional Danish Retailers
DESCRIPTION: GlenDronach's 11-Year-Old 2008 vintage was matured in the finest Pedro Ximenez casks bottled for the professional danish retailers.  This is one of 4650 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Clans of the Highlands - 4 x 5cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot contains 4 x 5cl Glenfiddich Clans of the Highlands Miniatures. This is 4 of the most famous clans from Scotland.

Kilchoman's Am Bùrach - meaning "the mess" in Gaelic! Created when a Stillman mixed together some Machir Bay and Port Matured Kilchoman while vatting casks! The whisky was filled back into Bourbon barrels and eventually given a finishing period in ruby port casks creating an unintentionally tasty dram!
This is the fourth edition in the Tamdhu Batch Strength Series.  It is another cracking single cask highly sherried expression. Bottled at 57.8%.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

This is Glenmorangie Astar was originally released in 2008 but was sadly discontinued in 2012 due to a lack of the very specific casks used to create it.  'Astar' is Gaelic for ‘journey’ - in reference to journey to perfection that Glenmorangie on in their search for the perfect casks to mature whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jim Beam - 8 Year Old 90 Proof Black Label
DESCRIPTION: A sour mash for this 8 year old Kentucy bourbon. Beams black label is famous for its flavour and mellow character. This will be mostly due to the charcoal filtering AFTER AGING.

A rare old vintage bottling of the Singleton (when it was still from Auchroisk).
This is a 70cl bottle.

Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 1988 Distiller's Reserve Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1988 and bottled in 2018 this is a Speyside single malt that is 30 years of age. 
Produced exclusively for Aldi.

Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 15 Year Old Black Watch Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION: 15 year old Glen Moray is contained within this lovely presentation tin which represents the Black Watch edition of the Highland Regiment.
The name Elijah Craig adorns some of Heaven Hill Brands’ finest bourbons.  This is a 12 Year Old Straight Kentucky small-batch bourbon.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Devil's Cask Inspired Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 10 Year Old Devil's Cask was released exclusively to the travel retail market.
1 litre in size, this limited edition is a unique fusion of rich fruit and dark chocolate.  It is a marriage of finest Oloroso Sherry and Wine Casks.

Matured in American Oak casks this malt was aged for 14 years.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Fraoch Mointeach - Edition II Heavily Peated
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare and heavily peated Highland single malt that has been specially selected by former distillery manager at Caol Ila, David Wood. It has been distilled at one of the oldest distilleries in the Highlands and was matured in an American Oak cask. 
Bottled at a whopping 62.4%.
The distillery has recently been bought by Mark Reynier and this is a release prior to this from the 1990's in the older style packaging.
This Flora and Fauna release is from Dailuaine distillery. This 16-year-old single malt was sherry matured and bottled at 43% by Diageo for the now very collectable series.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Fraoch Mointeach - Edition IV Cask Strength 2009
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare sweet and smokey single malt that has been specially selected by former distillery manager at Caol Ila, David Wood. It has been distilled at one of the oldest distilleries in the Highlands in 2009and was matured in an American Oak cask. 
Bottled at a whopping 59.8%
Only 78 bottles have been produced.
Triple-distilled and unpeated and part of a limited outturn of 5,100 bottles. This eight-year-old is much sought. Hazelburn is distilled at the Springbank distillery

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.
This 2009 vintage Glenfarclas Family Cask was bottled in 2018 as part of their Family Malt Collection.  Matured in Sherry casks.

The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.
This is bottling of Famous Grouse - 1987 Vintage, which was released following the success of the 1986 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

A private bottling from Kilchoman, one of Islay's younger distilleries. Distilled in 26/7/06 and matured in a bourbon cask #161/2006. This is one of just 76 bottles.
Bottled in 2016 at 59.9%, and featured the signature of Anthony Wills, distillery manager.

An early bottling from Mackinlay's old Scotch Whisky. The company was established in 1820 in Leith Scotland and have done some very famous bottlings in their time. 
Bottled at 70 Proof.

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

Distilled in 2002 from the now-closed distillery Port Charlotte, this dram has matured for 5 years before bottling by the Alchemist 2007. 
It is one of only 400 bottles.

Hibiki Japanese Harmony is made with malt whiskies from the Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries, as well as grain whisky from the Chita distillery. The whiskies are drawn from 5 different types of cask, including American white oak casks, Sherry casks and Mizunara oak casks. The blend itself was crafted by the Suntory Whisky blending team, led by Master Blender Shingo Torii. An elegant expression, with wafts of honey, orange, a herbaceous touch or two and light oak

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old Cask #0313 Greg Harris Stag
DESCRIPTION:
A private cask bottling to commemorate Greg Harris Stag do from the 27th - 30th of October in 2006. 
Bottled by Bruichladdich from cask #313...The Islay Stag!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 18 Year Old Gold Label Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend'.   However, this all changed in 2013, when Gold Label was revamped and replaced by a no-age-statement blend... 'Gold Label Reserve''.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 100th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

This Dalmore 12 year old no longer available to purchase from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.

Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

During 2000 Glenfiddich laid down casks and these were bottled in 2012. They were part of their whisky for the Travel Retail market.
They are a mix of European and American oak casks by Brian Kinsman, who at the time was the company's Malt Master.
The dram within was finished in ex-Bourbon barrels for two months.
This 8 year old Arran was time finished in Fontalloro wine casks from Felsina in Italy. This limited edition was bottled in 2007 at 55% ABV and is one of just 1,944 bottles produced.

This limited release is from Batch No.07.  This 1-year-old Ardnamurchin spirit was released by independent bottler Adelphi.  It was matured in px and oloroso sherry octaves.  Bottled on 1st August 2018, this is one of only 165 bottles.
This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

A 1970s bottling of Courvoisier's 3 star cognac.
70 Proof  & 24 FL.OZ

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Aldi commissioned this bottling to celebrate the 25th anniversary of their presence in Scotland. The dram within is from unnamed distillery in Speyside and has been aged in American oak casks.
It was released in 2019 and is the Christmas release of Glen Marnoch.
Distilled at an unnamed Speyside distillery this malt

The Bowmore Tempest 10 Year Old. This is the 6th release of the popular cask strength Islay expression.
It has been matured in first fill bourbon casks.
Said to have tropical fruits and layers of sweet almonds and an ocean breeze.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 15 Year Old - The Renaissance Chapter 1
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Garioch Chapter 1 of 4 is This 15 year old and part of a limited release of The Renaissance Series.
Each bottle is said to tell a different part of the start-up of the once closed distillery back in 1997.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Drumshanbo - Inaugural Release Single Pot Still
DESCRIPTION:
The inaugural release from Drumshanbo which is a triple distilled Single Pot Still with a mash bill of malted Irish barley.
This is a limited edition which of course contains whiskey from the first-ever cask distilled at the Shed Distillery in Leitrim. 
Inaugural releases have been hugely popular at the moment and this one is bound to follow suit.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

Jura Cask Editions celebrate flavours of selected European wine with the island malt and this unique red wine cask edition continues to explore the world of cask finishes in ever more innovative ways.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram - Winter Edition (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Inspired by a bygone tradition, the 2017 release of Glenmorangie A Midwinter Night’s Dram encapsulates the generosity of winter. At the year’s end, Glenmorangie’s Master Distiller would create a special single malt for our select craftsmen, the Men of Tain, to thank them for a job exceptionally well done. In 2015, we rekindled this custom’s spirit in the first release of Glenmorangie A Midwinter Night’s Dram, a marriage of superior casks which once held bourbon and Oloroso sherry. For 2017, this tradition was celebrated again, complementing these whiskies with a parcel finished in ex-Pedro Ximénez sherry casks, to create a richer, deeper, spicier single malt whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram - Winter Edition (2017)
DESCRIPTION: Inspired by a bygone tradition, the 2017 release of Glenmorangie A Midwinter Night’s Dram encapsulates the generosity of winter. At the year’s end, Glenmorangie’s Master Distiller would create a special single malt for our select craftsmen, the Men of Tain, to thank them for a job exceptionally well done. In 2015, we rekindled this custom’s spirit in the first release of Glenmorangie A Midwinter Night’s Dram, a marriage of superior casks which once held bourbon and Oloroso sherry. For 2017, this tradition was celebrated again, complementing these whiskies with a parcel finished in ex-Pedro Ximénez sherry casks, to create a richer, deeper, spicier single malt whisky.
This Ben Bracken 25-Year-Old single malt from Speyside was matured in oak casks. It was produced at an undisclosed distillery and bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. for Lidl.

Released in 2016, this single pot still Irish whiskey was initially matured in a combination of American and European oak casks for 9 to 12 years, before being transferred over to first fill Oloroso Sherry casks from Bodegas Lustau for a year.

A 1-litre bottling of 18-year-old Glenfarclas single malt initially released for travel retail, filling the gap between the 15 and 21-year-olds.
Grants, owned by the Grant family, is a Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch that has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.

There are three spirit stills at Glenlossie and they also have purifiers installed between the line arm and the condenser. This has a large bearing on the character of this whisky.
Part of the Diageo series Flora and Fauna, this single malt is 10 years old and was distilled just 4 miles outside of Elgin.
This single cask Benromach was bottled as UK exclusive. Distilled in 2011, matured in first-fill sherry hogshead #11 and bottled in 2019.  This is one of 319 bottles produced.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

This Ben Bracken 27-Year-Old single malt from Speyside was matured in oak casks. It was produced at an undisclosed distillery and bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. for Lidl and comes in a blue presentation box.

This is one of only 4111 bottles and is from Mackmyra Efva.
It is part of the distillery's 'Moment' series and has been matured in Oloroso and birch sap wine casks.
It is special because the casks were selected by Efva Attling who is a Swedish jewellery designer.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

This is Glenmorangie Astar was originally released in 2008 but was sadly discontinued in 2012 due to a lack of the very specific casks used to create it.  'Astar' is Gaelic for ‘journey’ - in reference to journey to perfection that Glenmorangie on in their search for the perfect casks to mature whisky.

Reading Spice in Gaelic, this single malt from Glenmorangie is named Spios and is the ninth release in the award-winning Private Editions series.
It has been fully matured in American rye whiskey casks.

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.

This 11-year-old single malt comes from the relatively unknown Craigellachie distillery in the Speyside region of Scotland.
This single cask was bottled in September 2018 for the MOM single cask series, following 11 years maturing in a single bourbon barrel. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.6%.
 
This is bottle number 015.

Distilled in 1989 this is a private Aberlour vintage and it was released just before the millennium.
This single cask was reserved for 'Jock Deans' bottle number 062 of 360.
Noted as "Dunnage Matured".

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 100th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
This is one of the earliest bottlings of the 10 year old in mini form.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...
This lot contains 6 x Match Box Assorted Minis.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - That Boutique-y Whisky Co. - Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
This Auchroisk single malt was bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company.  The Auchroisk distillery was built in 1974 by the folks from Justerini & Brooks and a large proportion of the malt goes into producing blends so single malts are harder to get your hands on.  This is one of just 127 bottles produced in Batch 1. The label features a zombie apocalypse too.
This is bottle number 102.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Skibo Castle - 10 Year Old Carnegie Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Highland 10-Year-Old single malt bottled exclusively bottled for Skibo Estate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.

So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

Produced by Haig and its claim to fame if the fact that it was the first container to be trademarked by the US Patent office.
This blend is one of the earliest Dimple recipe used by John Haig.
It dates back to the titular year.

This is a very nicely presented bottle of 21-year-old blended whisky from Whyte & Mackay, which is believed to be produced in the 1980's. The bottle comes with a metallic tag that hangs from the neck of the decanter. It also comes in a beautiful silky lined presentation box.

Hazelwood House - in Dufftown, Scotland - is the Art Deco inspired home of the grandaughter of Wlliam Grant and luminary of the Grant Family.
This 21 year old whisky by William Grant and Sons was first launched in Paris Duty-free.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Elements of Islay - Peat & Sherry Belgium Exclusive 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
A release exclusive to the country of Belgium from Elixir Distillers as part of the Elements of Islay series.
This blended malt contains peat notes and hints of sherry after being matured in a single Oloroso sherry cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 4 Year Old - Staoisha 2014 Daily Dram
DESCRIPTION: A young 2014 vintage Bunnahabhain Staoisha bottled for The Nectar’s Daily Dram series in 2019 at 62.1%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 12 Year Old Peated / PX Finish Heredotus Fumosus
DESCRIPTION:
The traditional way...Benriach still has and utilises its own floor for malting barley. They are one of only seven distilleries in Scotland to do so. 
We also have Billy walker to thank for this distillery being rescued...
This malt has been finished in Pedro Ximinez Sherry Butts and named Heredotus Fumosus.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenalba - 25 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Sold by the supermarket chain Lidl, this blended whisky was bottled by the Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Company.
This blend is a minimum of 25 years old and has a sherry cask finish.
Batch SE/425 Lot No 0274J

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 10 Year Old Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION: A 10 Year Old blended malt by Famous Grouse.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

Glen Garioch distillery was founded in 1797 by John Manson, making it amongst the oldest distilleries in Scotland. It is known for it's heavy, thick, cereal and spicy notes, which are attributed to its short fermentation period. In 1908 the distillery was bought over by Sanderson & Son, before merging with Booth's Distilleries and then DCL by 1937. Sadly, by this point production was slowing down, and in 1968 things finally came to a halt, closing down the operation due to struggles with water supply.
Thankfully in 1973, Stanley P. Morrison, owner of Bowmore and Auchentoshan, came to the rescue; securing a new water source and reopening the distillery. He also introduced innovative heat recovery systems, which were not just of benefit to the distillery, but the surrounding town as well, heating greenhouses and the local swimming pool.
This Glen Garioch has been aged for 15 years in the Aberdeenshire village of Old Meldrum.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. 
This is a 5cl bottling.
Now discontinued, Balblair is 'A spirit of the air' and was distilled 'Where the air is said to be the purest in Scotland' - a creation of the elements.

This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Aldi commissioned this bottling to celebrate the 25th anniversary of their presence in Scotland. The dram within is from unnamed distillery in Speyside and has been aged in American oak casks.
It was released in 2019 and is the Christmas release of Glen Marnoch.
Distilled at an unnamed Speyside distillery this malt

This is a non-age-statement expression of Nikka Taketsuru pure malt whisky, named after the company's founder, Masataka Taketsuru.  It contains a blend consisting of a high percentage of malt from Miyagikyo distillery, with the remainder coming from Yoichi, including some matured in sherry casks.

The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.6
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the sixth release in the series.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
Bottled for sale and while on sail on the QE2 cruise liner...This is a one litre bottle of Auchentoshan 12 year old.

This Scallywag Chocolate limited edition #2 is a blended Speyside malt and is the latest in a long line of Douglas Laing family fox terriers. It includes malts distilled from Macallan, Mortlach and Glenrothes distillery amongst others. It was matured in sweetly spiced sherry butts and vanilla'd bourbon hogsheads.  Bottled without colouring or chill-filtration.  This is one of only 500 bottles produced. 
This is bottle 208.
This lot contains x 3 miniatures:
This single cask Benromach was bottled as UK exclusive. Distilled in 2011, matured in first-fill sherry hogshead #11 and bottled in 2019.  This is one of 319 bottles produced.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This single grain malt has been matured in an ex-bourbon cask and independently bottled by SMWS. Only 168 bottles were produced.

Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2019 Highland Whisky Festival exclusive release which was celebrated for a week 10th - 17th of May 2019, this is a special release of bourbon aged single malt.
Distilled, matured, blended and bottled in Scotland exclusively for The Royal British Legion by Hamish Robertson & Co. Glasgow Scotland.
The discontinued expression Coeur de Cognac of Rémy Martin is a younger, relatively fruity Cognac. This unique bottle is filled with 70cl of Fine Champagne blend.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Loch Lomond - The Open - Special Edition - Gift Set
DESCRIPTION:
This Loch Lomond The Open special-edition gift set includes two Loch Lomond tumblers and Distillers Cut special-edition single malt 70cl from Loch Lomond.  It was released as part of the distillery’s The Open Course Collection and named after Royal Portrush Golf Club.
The official whisky of the Open, Loch Lomond have created this series in collaboration with 2011 Open Champion Darren Clarke and was matured in three types of American oak casks.

The 2006 vintage Moët & Chandon Grand Vintage Champagne is like the previous bottlings, unique and original. This is the Cellar Managers personal, free interpretation of the singular qualities of that year's grapes. Made with a blend of 42% Chardonnay, 39% Pinot Noir and 19% Pinot Meunier.

This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

DESCRIPTION:
