Old Ballantruan is produced at Speyside's Tomintoul distillery using heavily peated barley. This is the first-ever bottling with an age statement.  50% ABV too!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenalba - 22 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Sold by the supermarket chain Lidl, this blended whisky was bottled by the Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Company.
This blend is a minimum of 22 years old and has a sherry cask finish.
Batch JS/322

This release is by Malts of Scotland under the motto ‘Special Bottlings for Special Moments’.
This bottle is from the images of Dufftown series and is the "St. Michael's Episcopal Church" edition.  This is one of 557 bottles.
This is bottle number 142.

Released in 2018, Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old is a rich and smoky whisky made by the artisan minded Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known, is heavily peated to 40ppm as part of their journey to make the ultimate “Islay” Islay whisky.
The Port Charlotte 10 Year Old whisky is produced in tall, narrow-necked spirit stills. This creates a lot of reflux and maximizes the amount of copper contact that the vapour receives. The result is a smooth, silky whisky, with noticeable floral elements.  Following distillation, the new-make spirit is matured in a combination of first fill ex-bourbon casks (65%), second fill bourbon casks (10%) and second fill French wine casks from Bordeaux (25%).  The whisky is bottled on site. Neither chill filtering or caramel is used.
Bowmore 9 Year Old is a recent addition to their core range. Matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this is a limited release.

Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.
A three-grain bourbon from Chicago's FEW distilleries. This bourbon is packed full of toffee, clove, vanilla and warming spice goodness! This bottle is from batch 15.3.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 9 Year Old - Game of Thrones - House Lannister
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo collaborated with HBO to release a limited-edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
This 9-year-old Islay single malt from Lagavulin represents the House Lannister - one of the richest and oldest dynasties in the Seven Kingdoms. This 9 year old was matured exclusively in first-fill ex-bourbon casks.

This exciting release by Wolfburn distillery was both their first-ever small-batch Wolfburn and the first time the distillery has created a lightly peated spirit.  This single malt was matured in 100 litre first-fill ex-bourbon casks. The name comes from where these little rascals were matured: warehouse 1, stow 28. Batch No.128 is a release of 6,000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.
This is a 20cl hand-filled exclusive bottling from warehouse 9 at Bunnahabhain.  It has been filled from cask 17 Palo Cortado.

This is an older style bottling of Danston 17 Year Old, that has been matured in oak casks.  It is a well-presented bottle - typical of one of the finest distilleries in Scotland.  It is a fine dram that has a lightly peated flavour with a sweet aftertaste.

From the Highland distillery, just outside of Buckie, the Scottish village comes this Glenglassaugh bottling. It was distilled on the 30th of July 2012 and bottled in 2014 by Indy bottler The Octave Cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 1988 Distiller's Reserve Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1988 and bottled in 2018 this is a Speyside single malt that is 30 years of age. 
Produced exclusively for Aldi.

Distilled in 2009 and finished in Caribbean rum barrels for one year, this 10-year-old Tomatin.  This is a limited edition of only 7,200 bottles produced at 46% ABV. It has notes of tropical fruit and chocolate in this exotic Highland dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Marnoch - 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Aldi commissioned this bottling to celebrate the 25th anniversary of their presence in Scotland. The dram within is from unnamed distillery in Speyside and has been aged in American oak casks.
It was released in 2019 and is the Christmas release of Glen Marnoch.
Distilled at an unnamed Speyside distillery this malt

This Ben Bracken 22-Year-Old single malt from Speyside was matured in oak casks. It was produced at an undisclosed distillery and bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. for Lidl and comes in a smart green presentation box.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

A Highland Park special edition to celebrate 50 years of the Scottish Ballet. 
Released in 2019 this is one of 5000 bottles. A donation from Highland Park will go to The Scottish ballet for every bottle sold.

This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.
Bottled in 2004.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 12 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
A vital component in the much loved blend Johnnie Walker, this Linkwood official bottling is rare!
This bottling is part of the very popular flora and fauna series by the drinks giant Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: SMWS - Feis Ile 2018 - Discovery Pack  (5 x 2.5cl)
DESCRIPTION: Released by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society in partnership with the Dram Team. This Discovery Collection includes 5 x sample selection of 2.5cl miniatures as below:

The distillery has called this bottle Toiteach which is Gaelic for ‘smoky’. 
Bunnahabhain is generally regarded as the lighter of the Islay whiskies, although the Toiteach releases are their heavily peated spirit.

This bottle is a 20008 edition of the Royal Lochnagar - Distillers Edition. It was double matured in fine old Muscat Cask-wood which brings a sweet floral richness to the spirit.
It was distilled in the year 1996 and bottled in the year 2008.
Batch RL/96-8S

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.

So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

This traditional size dipping dog, with a proper old penny at the bottom.
Copper dipping dogs originated in the 1800's in Scotland. Distillery workers crafted dipping dogs to lower into casks to steal whiskey. The dipping dogs were attached to chains, secured to the workers' belts and concealed in their pant legs. The dipping dogs were attached to chains, secured to the workers' belts and concealed in their pant legs. The thieves could then easily take a drink on the job or sneak it out. 
Approx dimensions: 
14 inches tall 
2 inches diameter  
Holds approx 200ml.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teaninich - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: One of the rarer bottlings from the Flora and Fauna series. Teaninich, in the highlands of Scotland, was part of the Scottish Malt Distillers (later Diageo), which included Aberfeldy, Clynelish, Caol Ila, Mortlach, Rosebank and many more.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 15 Year Old - French Oak Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old expression from The Glenlivet, was matured in French Limousin Oak casks. Limousin Oak is a popular choice for the maturation of Cognac.  Glenlivet were one of the first to use French oak for making whisky, a technique that has since been imitated the world over.
This is a very peated edition from the Isle of Jura.  Prophecy is made from a selection of old and rare Jura whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

This lot includes 3 x 5cl bottlings of Glenfiddich in a presentation tube: 
There is no lid for the presentation tube.

Each season Wolfburn produces a limited-release bottle exclusively for visitors to the distillery and this Spring it was released online instead. Created using two of their oldest sherry casks: a 2013 hogshead and a tiny wee octave – giving it a wonderful colour and depth of flavour.
This lot contains x 12 x 5cl miniatures:

Love an Islay malt? Possibly Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen?
Forming part of Big Peat's World Tour, this limited edition features a bespoke illustration of Big Peat wearing what appears to be an Argentina football shirt on the label.

This bottle is an independent bottling from Specialty Drinks, it is a 12 year old malt from Port Askaig in Islay. 
There is no distillery called Port Askaig so it has been named after an ancient ferry port and fishing harbour from the east coast of the island.

The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

A striking black ceramic decanter commemorating the battle of Culloden and 'The Spirit of the Highland Clans'.

This Tomatin 12 Year Old was released prior to 2014 as it was bottled at 40% (after 2014, it was bottled at 43%) It was matured in a bourbon cask and finished in Spanish sherry casks. The result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice.

The Teeling Whisky Co. believe in continuing the evolution of Irish Whiskey by creating new and unique expressions.
This is third in the collaborative series with Galway Bay Brewery which captures the unique influence Galway Bay's "Diving Bell" Strong Ale has played further maturation to small batch blend.

Named after the mythical creature that stalked Tomatin villagers for centuries. A limited-edition expression of Cù Bòcan.

Released in 2019, this non-age stated Glengoyne is the first of the Legacy Series.
Completely free of peat this bottling features a 'heart' of first-fill European oak Oloroso sherry casks.

This is the second release of Ailsa Bay's Sweet Smoke - it has had a redesign from its first release. The 1.2 is said to be both smokier and sweeter than before. It scientifically distilled to 022 parts peat and 019 parts sweet.
This sausage dog is filled with Macalister - 8-Year-Old - Pure Malt.
The kit includes a beaker, a pipette, a selection of whiskies to blend and an empty bottle to blend into:

Found on the East coast of Scotland on Buckie road this distillery was founded by Alexander Edward in 1897.
The malted barley doesn't have a hint of peat smoke and this liquid was aged for 12 years before bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 12 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
A vital component in the much loved blend Johnnie Walker, this Linkwood official bottling is rare!
This bottling is part of the very popular flora and fauna series by the drinks giant Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.
One of the most Northern distilleries on the UK Mainland, Wolfburn is located in Thurso. This was bottled at 58% in 2018 this was matured in first fill bourbon casks.

There are three spirit stills at Glenlossie and they also have purifiers installed between the line arm and the condenser. This has a large bearing on the character of this whisky.
Part of the Diageo series Flora and Fauna, this single malt is 10 years old and was distilled just 4 miles outside of Elgin.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tomatin - Metal - Five Virtues - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Stright from the Highlands, this Tomatin was matured in first-fill bourbon barrels. 
It forms part of the Five Virtues Series.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.5
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the fifth release in the series.

This Speyside single malt Beinn Dubh is Gaelic for black mountain...
If you have ever seen the colour of his whisky...you will be able to see why!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 12 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
A vital component in the much loved blend Johnnie Walker, this Linkwood official bottling is rare!
This bottling is part of the very popular flora and fauna series by the drinks giant Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.
This lot includes 4 x 20cl samples from Kilchoman Distillery.

Jack Teeling founded the company in 2012 from casks that he filled from Cooley distillery. 
This is batch one and as such the first commercial release of the single pot still.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. 
This is a 5cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Peat Faerie - 7 Year Old - SMWS Batch #4
DESCRIPTION: Batch 4 was discovered when developing its predecessor. The Tasting Panel sampled a number of blended recipes at different proportions, strengths and ages and some of the younger blends were among the highest scoring. This 7-year old recipe is born from both barrels and hogsheads from Islay and Speyside, and features a stronger Islay influence than its older namesake. This is one of 2172 bottles.
Contains 3 x  whisky miniatures:

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scottish Parliament - 15 Year Old The Member's Blend
DESCRIPTION: A blended malt with a minimum age of 15 years, this bottling was produced by Gordon and Macphail. It was chosen for the Scottish parliament.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! From Sweden's Mackmyra in collaboration with Japanese tea specialists Yuko Ono Sthlm. Grönt Te is a Swedish single malt finished in casks seasoned with a blend of Oloroso sherry and green tea leaves!
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

Benromach Organic was distilled in 2011 in Virgin American Oak Casks and then later bottled in 2019. 
Every step of the careful making of this whisky is Certified Organic, this whisky also meets the rigorous UK Soil Association standards regarding growing the ingredients, distillation, maturing and bottling.

This Laphroaig has been matured in four different types of casks; virgin American oak barrels, European oak hogsheads, ex-bourbon barrels & small quarter casks. Originally released as a travel retail exclusive

This is a 1-litre box of 12 year old single malt from Macallan, bottled in the 1980s. Very collectable indeed.
 
THIS LOT CONTAINS THE BOX ONLY.

Bunnahabhain Stiuireadair is a competitor for the 12 year old.
This bottling was matured in First and Second fill sherry casks of varying ages.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

Released in 2018, this new release from Highland Park was originally only available through Amazon UK. 
"Viking Tribe" is now part of the core Highland Park range. 
This single malt was released as a celebration of the togetherness shown by the Vikings.
This 12 year old is a  flagship bottling from the Lowland Glenkinchie distillery - it replaces the 10 year-old as the main expression of the Lowland style in the Classic Malts range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited-edition 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar and it is part of Diagio's 2018 collaboration with HBO.  Each single malt in the series relates to the land of houses of the Game of Thrones television series.  The Royal Lochnagar bottle is decorated with a rampant black Stag, the sigil of House Baratheon that once flew on banners above the Stormlands and King’s Landing signifying absolute power.

Perfect for those that love big, rich, peaty and smoky malt whiskies.  The Peat Monster combines very smoky malt whisky from Islay with medium-peated Highland whiskies to create a balanced but monstrous blend.

A bottle of Longrow Peated - This is essentially the awesome Longrow C.V. bottling in new packaging, which used to be Longrow's entry-level whisky. Longrow is Springbank's heavily peated whisky - this is a no age statement expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Small Batch​ Bourbon Cask Matured
DESCRIPTION:
The self-acclaimed first Islay malt to exist and acknowledged as one of the most well-balanced malts in the world, comes this small-batch bourbon cask matured dram. 
Matured in both first and second fill ex-Bourbon casks.

Rutherford's 12 Year Old
Rutherford's specialised releasing blended whisky in stylish decanters, like this one.

One of Glenglassaugh's new releases from 2014, the Torfa is matured exclusively in Bourbon barrels.
Peated to 20ppm.

This is the relatively more heavily peated version of the single malt, made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

From an undisclosed distillery and bottled for Apolo Window blinds. 
No ABV is stated on the bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ballechin / Edradour - 10 Year Old Heavily Peated
DESCRIPTION:
The name has a close connection with Edadour as it takes its name from a closed distillery that would have previously been located close to Edradour site.
This is Edradour's first 10 year old peated whisky.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

This bottling from Old Pulteney, Stroma which takes its name from a windswept isle situated off the rugged Caithness coast. Made at the distillery with award-winning Old Pulteney single malt whisky. It tastes equally well served neat, with ice or in a cocktail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Allied Distillers - Queen's Award Miniature Set (10 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: Allied Distillers Queen's Award Miniature Selection - this set includes 10 x 5cl:

So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...
Mossburn has started to independently bottle and release whiskies. This is a 10-year-old single malt fromInchgower, distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2017 at 46% ABV.

Aerstone Sea Cask comes from William Grant at 10 years old.
Its a single malt from the Ailsa Bay Distillery.
10 years of maturation wasn't spent at sea, although those maritime notes were soaked up in the warehouses by the sea on the Ayrshire coast.
Teeling Single Malt Irish Whiskey was produced with 100% malt whiskey unsing; Sherry, Port, Madeira, White Burgundy and Cabernet Sauvignon wine-cask-finished-whiskeys.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.
This is a 10 year old bottling by The Tormore Distillery, each hour you can hear the chimes from the distillery across the quiet hills and tumbling waters of Speyside.

Released in early 2019, this 12-year-old single malt from Tobermory was launched in celebration of the distillery returning to life after a two-year hiatus. It was matured in American oak casks, before being bottled at 46.3% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

A bottle of Longrow Peated - This is essentially the awesome Longrow C.V. bottling in new packaging, which used to be Longrow's entry-level whisky. Longrow is Springbank's heavily peated whisky - this is a no age statement expression.

This is a 6 year old bottling of Craigellachie which was distilled in February 2008 and specially selected and bottled exclusively for The Whisky Shop customers as part of thier Glenkeir Treasures collection.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.

Handcrafted in England, this French oak matured single malt is by Adnams at the Copper House distillery in Southwold.
It was released in December 2013.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.

Handcrafted in England, this American oak matured triple grain is by Adnams at the Copper House distillery in Southwold.
It was released in December 2013.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.
A blended, fresh, fruity, no-age-statement whisky from Japan's Yamazakura range, which is brought to market by Japanese company Sasanokawa Shuzo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.
A selection of 4 Maynard's Port bottles in a beautifully presented box, including 10 Year Old, 20 Year Old, 30 Year Old and 40 Year Old.  Bottled in 2017.

Love an Islay malt? Possibly Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen?
The second release for the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, this limited edition features a bespoke illustration of Big Peat playing the bagpipes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Three Drinkers Scotch Whisky - 17 Year Old - Cask Selection No. 1
DESCRIPTION: Produced by the hosts of Amazon Prime TV show The Three Drinkers, Aidy Smith, Helena Nicklin and Colin Hampden-White. The Three Drinkers Scotch Whisky Cask Selection No. 1 is a 17 year old blend, with flavour elements inspired by their journey around Scotland. The back label of each bottle has been signed by the trio!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 12 Year Old - Old Style
DESCRIPTION: Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!

Part of a Glenfiddich's Casks Collection, Select Cask has been matured in a combination of European oak, ex-bourbon and ex-red-wine casks specially selected by malt master Brian Kinsman. It was then married in a solera vat. This is a 1 litre bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Very Old Tom - That Boutique-y Gin Company
DESCRIPTION:
That Boutique-y Gin Company, the sister company to That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible gins from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
'Very Old Tom' made with a medley of spirits (some unaged, some aged and some very well-aged) mixed together to form the base, then combined with juniper, coriander, angelica, bitter orange and liquorice alongside a touch of cane sugar for classic Old Tom sweetness.
This bottle is from batch 1 and is one of 1562 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 761.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 15 -year-old from Dufftown Distillery, in the heart of Speyside, has been matured in European and American oak casks. It was crafted using pure water from Highlandman John's well.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

Macallan Gold was first introduced in 2012 as part of the distillery's 1824 range of non-age statement expressions, before being renamed Macallan Gold Double Cask in 2018 as part of the new core range. Matured in a combination of first fill and refill American oak and European oak sherry casks to create an incredibly smooth and rich single malt. Soft gold in colour, this is the lightest expression of the Macallan range, but still packed with typical Speyside Macallan flavours.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold was introduced in 2015 inspired by its location in the Highland's of Scotland, making it one of the highest and coldest distilleries - "Crafted by the Cold".  It is made exclusively with the spirit that has been distilled between October and March.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Finlaggan - Old Reserve - Islay Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Finlaggan is from an unknown Islay distillery.
"The Lord Of The Isles".

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Classic Malts - Talisker 10 Year Old & Cragganmore 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A pair of 20cl bottles of two favourites from the Classic Malts selection - Talisker and Cragganmore.

A bottle of Longrow Peated - This is essentially the awesome Longrow C.V. bottling in new packaging, which used to be Longrow's entry-level whisky. Longrow is Springbank's heavily peated whisky - this is a no age statement expression.
Japanese single grain whisky from the Chita distillery, owned by Suntory. This is their main expression - a whisky matured in a combination of Sherry, bourbon and wine casks.

This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 12-year-old blended Whisky.
It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.
This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.

Bottled in 2015 this Benriach is a 12-Year-Old matured in Sherry Wood Pre-2018.
Fully matured in Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks.  
This BenRiach was the winner of the '12YO and under' category in the 2014 Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival.
A nose of dark chocolate, sultanas and rich spices.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Paul John - Brilliance Indian Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
This is from a unique whisky distillery called Paul John in Goa, India.
 
This bottling was for export only and is batch 1.

Love an Islay malt? Possibly Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen?
Look no further, this blend contains them all!
A Douglas Laing bottling and at 40ppm one for the peaty lovers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Glen Ord - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This 12-year-old from Glen Ord Distillery, in the heart of the Highlands, has been matured in European and American oak casks. 
Perfectly balanced, naturally rich and smooth while being slow batch distilled.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited-edition 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar and it is part of Diagio's 2018 collaboration with HBO.  Each single malt in the series relates to the land of houses of the Game of Thrones television series.  The Royal Lochnagar bottle is decorated with a rampant black Stag, the sigil of House Baratheon that once flew on banners above the Stormlands and King’s Landing signifying absolute power.
Back in the 70s they said you shouldn't mix peat with Speyside, that smokiness & sweetness couldn't exist together. But this distillery followed their nose and did it their own way.

From the Speyside distillery, Glenfiddich, this is their Experimental Series. The single malt was finished in bespoke craft IPA barrels. This pioneering malt is imbued with unique zesty citrus notes and the subtle tang of fresh hops.

This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 12-year-old blended Whisky.
It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.
This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.
This includes 2 x 5cl bottlings of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.2 x Bowmore Golf Balls6 x Bowmore Tee's1 x Bowmore Metal Miniature Hip Flask
A wee dram pack containing the Bunnahabhain Fèis Ìle 2020 releases – the 2010 Mòine Amontillado Finish (3cl, 56.9%) and the 2002 Madeira Cask Finish (3cl, 53%).
Glen Struan is a Pure Malt which has been created with some of the finest single malt scotch whiskies, aged in oak casks.
A 12 year old single malt from the Speyside distillery, Tormore.  Launched in 2004 this is the distillery's main official bottling.  Tormore is part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio of distilleries.
This a classic 15-Year-Old deluxe blend. Based on Glenkinchie with traces of other more northerly distilleries, Dimple benefits from an extended marrying period.
This is a 1L bottling of the popular dram Glenlivet 12-Year-Old.  It has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.
Dew of Ben Nevis is a deluxe blended Scotch whisky from Ben Nevis Distillery.  All the whisky has been aged for over 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Perth - Sherry Cask Blended Whisky
DESCRIPTION: Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth Range added this beautifully sherried blended malt made from venerable casks of Jerez - Sherry Butt, Sherry Puncheon, Sherry Hogsheads.
A rum from Trinidad and Tobago's famed Angostura company, this is a blend of spirit aged for at least eight years in bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited-edition 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar and it is part of Diagio's 2018 collaboration with HBO.  Each single malt in the series relates to the land of houses of the Game of Thrones television series.  The Royal Lochnagar bottle is decorated with a rampant black Stag, the sigil of House Baratheon that once flew on banners above the Stormlands and King’s Landing signifying absolute power.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 15 Year Old - Green Label
DESCRIPTION: Each malt whisky is matured for a minimum of 15 years blended to give Johnnie Walker Green Label a fresh and unique flavour.  The signature malts provide the key taste influences for this 15-year-old whisky. Talisker, Caol ILa  Cragganmore and Linkwood are more are expertly blended to make this award-winning blend.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old - Non Chill Filtered
DESCRIPTION:
This Aberlour 12 Year Old, has been non-chill filtration which is the process where your golden dram is cooled to 0°C and passed through filters to remove acids that turn it cloudy at low temperatures.
Havent tried it yet? It is lovely!
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Timorous Beastie - Douglas Laing Small Batch
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling of this small batch #1. The Timorous Beastie Highland blended malt Scotch whisky was matured and bottled at 46.8% ABV. It has tasting sweet tasting notes including warm syrup over sponge and ripe, juicy nectarines.
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is the first release in their maturing range of whiskies. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks for 10 long years gives this Tamdhu bottling its glorious natural colour.
This is a 10 year old single malt from Benromach Distillery in Speyside. It was handcrafted by just 2 men, at what was Speyside's smallest distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Glendullan - Game of Thrones - House of Tully
DESCRIPTION: The Singleton Glendullan Reserve hails from Dufftown distillery. Glendullan is located on the banks of the River Fiddich, so it has been cleverly paired with House Tully at Riverrun, which is in the region known as The Riverlands. This single malt Scotch whisky is decorated with a jumping trout - the sigil of House Tully.

Skiren is known as the honeyed tropical one because of its smooth, creamy sweetness with a hint of tropical fruit, citrus and coastal heather. It was exclusively matured in 100% first-fill American Oak Casks, selected by Scapa artisans. This is batch 1 which was introduced into their range in 2015.  It is made up of whisky produced on the industry's only remaining Lomond Still.
'Skiren' - old Norse, glittering, bright skies.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Monkey Shoulder is an excellent blended malt produced by William Grant and Sons, consisting of Glenfiddich, Balvenie and Kininvie.  
Each batch is produced from a small selection of 27 casks.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range. Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old Pure Highland Malt
DESCRIPTION: This is an older style bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Remy Martin - VSOP Mature Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Years of aging in oak casks at the heart of Remy’s historic cellars, this is a classic Cognac. 
Remy Martin VSOP Fine Champagne Awards2010: Gold Medal at the Spirits Business Cognac Masters (UK)
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 10 Year Old Chardonnay Finish
DESCRIPTION: This Glen Moray single malt from Speyside has been matured in chardonnay casks.  This is an older bottling of Glen Moray that has long been discontinued. It has a light gold colour and is gently spiced with fruity butterscotch notes.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Moonshot Gin - That Boutique - Y Gin Company
DESCRIPTION:
Moonshot gin has been made by developing the botanicals including juniper, coriander, cubeb pepper, fresh lemon peel, and moon rock. Every gram of the botanicals in this bottle were lifted into near space (over 21km) in September 2017 and exposed to the air pressure of less than 1/100th of that at sea level, before being vacuum distilled. 
Boutique-Y is a well know whisky brand.
This bottle is number 1161 of 3850 from batch 5.
A 10 year old single malt from the Speyside region that has been matured only in sherry seasoned oak cask.

This 10 year old is an older style bottling from Glenkinchie Distillery, that comes presented in the famous orange box - with the classic malt stamp on the front of the box. The Glenkinchie 10 year old has since been replaced by the 12 year old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Douglas Laing - Rock Oyster Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
This is not Douglas Laings first time around the black with a branded blended malt...
Big Peat (Islay) 
Scally Wag (Speyside)
They have followed a great trend and this would go under the bracket of Island whiskies including Arran, Jura, Orkney malts and Islay whiskies.
Tlàth matured in American oak ex-bourbon barrels perhaps making it a gentle/ mellow expression.
This Penderyn has been matured in ex-bourbon American Oak before finishing in ex-Madeira oak barriques.

This rich and intense dram has been selectively finished in Cognac casks.  The whisky has been inspired by its namesake Captain William. 
The captain as everyone loved to call him was very ambitious and a very determined man who was fighting in France when he inherited the distillery.

This is a limited edition release from the Welsh distillery, finished in Madeira wine casks.  This whisky is in honour of Thomas Jefferson, third President of the United States, who also has a Welsh heritage.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Glendullan - Game of Thrones - House of Tully
DESCRIPTION: The Singleton Glendullan Reserve hails from Dufftown distillery. Glendullan is located on the banks of the River Fiddich, so it has been cleverly paired with House Tully at Riverrun, which is in the region known as The Riverlands. This single malt Scotch whisky is decorated with a jumping trout - the sigil of House Tully.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cardhu Gold Reserve - Game of Thrones - House Targaryen
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Cardhu Gold Reserve 'House Targaryen' is part of the Game of Thrones collection by Diageo.

Distilled from the Speyside distillery Benriach this dram was distilled in 2010 and bottled in 2019. 
Stored in a sherry cask this single malt was bottled for Tyndrumwhisky.com
This lot contains 7 x single malts from the Speyside region, each 5cl -

A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

Tamnavulin 10 Year old from Speyside is naturally light malt and only takes its colour from its oak its matured in.
This malt carries the Gaelic name from the mill on the hill by the distillery.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

Part of the core range from Glenrothes.
This expression won the 2006 Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition.
A rum from Trinidad and Tobago's famed Angostura company, this is a blend of spirit aged for at least eight years in bourbon barrels.
This lot includes 10 x 5cl:
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12-Year-Old Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
A very collectable miniature from the Campbel town distillery. Bottled at 46% this single malt is 12 years old.
Cutty Sark 12-Year-Old deluxe blended scotch whisky by Berry Bros & Rudd Ltd.

This limited edition blended Speyside malt is the latest in a long line of Douglas Laing family fox terriers. It includes malts distilled from Macallan, Mortlach and Glenrothes distillery amongst others. It was bottled without colouring or chill filtration.

This is a newer style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet. The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Love an Islay malt? Possibly Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen?
Look no further, this blend contains them all!
A Douglas Laing bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old - Double Cask Matured
DESCRIPTION: This Aberlour 12 Year Old, has been double cask matured in two handmade oak cask types.  The double maturation both traditional oak and sherry casks adds depth of character to this single malt, now bottled at 40% abv.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland.  This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland.  Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

This bottle of Justerini and Brooks blended whisky is estimated to have been bottled for the Duty-Free market in the 1970s.  This is 1 Imperial Quart (1.14L.  
J&B Rare is so recognisable as they haven't changed the iconic bottle or label design much for decades!

From the Speyside distillery, Glenfiddich, this is their Experimental Series. The single malt was finished in bespoke craft IPA barrels. This pioneering malt is imbued with unique zesty citrus notes and the subtle tang of fresh hops.

Glengoyne is mostly known for being one of the only Scottish whiskies to be distilled from completely unpeated malt.
Dried naturally before fermentation and distillation begin gives an elegant, medium-bodied style.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

Laphroaig  Select has been created using a combination of whisky from a number of different types of cask, including Oloroso Sherry butts, white American oak, Pedro Ximenez seasoned hogsheads, quarter casks and first-fill bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Croft Original - Fine Old Pale Cream Sherry (1970s)
DESCRIPTION: Croft Original - Fine Old Pale Cream Sherry is a blend of Amontillado and Oloroso sherry.  This bottling dates back to the 1970s. ABV not stated. 70cl bottling.

From the Knockdhu distillery, this is their 12 year old dram.
Pronounced [a-nock].
Matured in hand selected American Bourbon Barrels.
This Loch Lomond single malt was matured in American Oak Casks and is a subtly peated dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - Elgin Classic - Port Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: Glen Moray is quietly matured on the banks of the River Lossie in Elgin, the capital of Speyside. This release was finished in port casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old from Dufftown Distillery, in the heart of Speyside, has been matured in European and American oak casks. It was crafted using pure water from Highlandman John's well.
This is a core bottling from the Isle of Jura's only distillery. Aged in ex-bourbon casks, this 10 year old has the distillery's classic style.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - The Whisky Society (With Glass) 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Whisky Society gift set includes a 20xl bottling of Lagavulin - 16-Year-Old and a glass.
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16-year-old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - The Whisky Society (With Glass) 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
This Whisky Society gift set includes a 20xl bottling of Lagavulin - 16-Year-Old and a glass.
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16-year-old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

That Boutique-y Gin Company, the sister company to That Boutique-y Whisky Company, bottles all manner of incredible gins from top distilleries and brands from around the world.
That Boutique-y Gin Company transport you back in time with this expression to 11th Century Ireland and a monastic garden. At this time, distilling had just arrived and numerous herbs and plants were grown. There’s no citrus or Far Eastern spices in this gin; instead, quince, rosehip, and bletted medlars join classic gin botanicals such as juniper.
This bottle is from batch 2 and is one of 792 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 466.

Grant's Elementary range was originally released for the Travel Retail Market.  Each release represents a different element relating to whisky production and the age statement matches the element's atomic number; Oxygen is the 8th element and this expression has been aged for 8 years in ex-Bourbon American oak casks.
Oxygen differs from the other whiskies in the range in that it is a Scotch Blended Grain whisky.
A smooth Speyside 12-year-old single malt, bottled for Marks & Spencer.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12-Year-Old Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12-Year-Old Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12-Year-Old Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Caledonian Curling Club - 10 Year Old Speyside
DESCRIPTION:
A specially selected malt for the Royal Caledonian curling club. It is 10 year old Speyside single malt.
Bottled at 40% and 70cl
This lot contains x 3 Miniatures:

First revealed towards the end of 2014, the Founder's Reserve was to replace The Glenlivet 12 year old in many mature markets (despite initial indications that it would sit beside it).  The bottling is named in tribute to distillery founder George Smith.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: New Town Blends - The Advocates Batch Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
This is the first release from Edinburgh Whisky Ltd.'s New Town Blends range - The Advocates Batch is a blended malt.
It has been made with whiskies from the Speyside region.
This lot contains The Morrison Collection Miniatures:

Laphroaig  Select has been created using a combination of whisky from a number of different types of cask, including Oloroso Sherry butts, white American oak, Pedro Ximenez seasoned hogsheads, quarter casks and first-fill bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cardhu Gold Reserve - Game of Thrones - House Targaryen
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Cardhu Gold Reserve 'House Targaryen' is part of the Game of Thrones collection by Diageo.
A 1980s bottling of Harveys Bristol Cream Sherry, with presentation tube featuring the coat of arms of the city of Bristol.
Ballantine's Gold Seal takes in 40 of Scotlands greatest malts. It was matured in Oak casks for 12 years or more to produce this lovely 'liquid gold' blend.
A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.

The 12-year-old is Glenfiddich is Glenfiddich's signature malt.
It has been aged for a total of 12 years in both Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon Cask.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.

This is a global superstar endorsed blended Irish whiskey produced with the help of former Bushmills distillery manager David Elder.  A great marketing ploy as Proper Twelve, is of course not even close to twelve years old.  Proper No. Twelve takes its name from Dublin 12, the area where Connor McGregor grew up. 
It is described as rich and smooth having been triple distilled. We will let you decide for yourself!
This Loch Lomond single malt was matured in American Oak Casks and is a subtly peated dram.

Inspired by the whisky left behind in Antarctica by Sir Ernest Shackleton in the early 1900s and discovered frozen but intact over 100 years later, this blended malt continues in the footsteps of The Discovery and The Journey.  It is created once again by Master Blender Richard Patterson based on the flavour profile of Shackleton's favourite tipple, though now more accessible than the aforementioned limited edition releases.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chocolate Cherry Gin - That Boutique - Y Gin Company
DESCRIPTION:
Chocolate Cherry Gin by That Boutique-Y has been produced exclusively via distillation. This gin is said to be fantastic in a Singapore Sling or even with a splash of coke.
Boutique-Y is a well know whisky brand.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - Spey Cascade
DESCRIPTION: The Spey Cascade release was inspired by the top fishing available on the River Spey - the front label also features a fish.  This whisky was matured in a mixture of sherry and Bourbon casks, resulting in a balanced and complex dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Compass Box Great King Street - Artist's Blend (50cl)
DESCRIPTION: Artist’s Blend is a tribute to the blenders of the late 19th century, individuals who used artistry, creativity and craft to pioneer a spirit that became one of the world’s most famous and desirable drinks. This expression is first in Compass Box's Great King Street range, named for the address of their Edinburgh office, marking their second decade in business.

This is the first official bottling from the re-opened Glen Keith distillery in Speyside.
It was revived in 2013 and whose spirits normally appear in blends such as Chivas Regal and 100 Pipers.
It is a no-age-statement whisky with notes of poached pears, honeycomb and vanilla toffee.
This 12 Year Old by Harrods has been matured at Tamnavulin Distillery in oak casks and is said to be influenced by the gentle air of Glenlivet.
A bottle of Jura 10 Year Old.  Originally built in 1810, the distillery fell into disrepair and wasn't revived until the 1960's by two local estate owners.
A 10 year old single malt from the Speyside region that has been matured only in sherry seasoned oak cask.
Bowmore No.1 is made up from single malt aged in first-fill bourbon casks and is named after Bowmore's famous No.1 Vaults on Islay.

It does exactly what it says on the tin, 'the gentle dram with a peated tang."
Pronounced Tom-in-t'owl this is a non age statement release.
This is a non-age statement bottling from Glen Grant.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.
This lot contains 8 x single malts from the Speyside region, each 5cl -

This Famous Grouse blend is made from 100% Scotch Whiskies including the Edrington-owned Highland Park and The Macallan. 
Famous Grouse blended scotch whisky was first produced by Matthew Gloag & Son Ltd in 1896, and is currently produced and owned by The Edrington Group.
This bottle is estimated to be from the 1990s.
This lot includes 6 x 5cl:

Highland Park Dragon Legend
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Irish Reserve - 12 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled for Aldi the supermarket chain, this bottling is suspected to be bottled by Bushmills.
Regarded by many as the best Irish single malt whisky this is very well-aged dram.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.
Traditional Oak Cask, a core bottling by Benrmoach, with 80% of casks were bourbon-matured and the remaining 20% matured in sherry casks.
A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.
A 10-year-old single malt expression from Tomintoul aged in hand-picked oak barrels.  This single malt is known as the gentle dram.

This bottling from Antiquary is a blend of some of Scotland's greatest 12-year-old malt and grain whiskies, including Royal Lochnagar, Tomatin, Cragganmore, Mortlach, Bowmore, Glenkinchie to name a few. Also, a quirky feature is that In the lid of this bottle box, there is a coaster that pops out!
